:<small>{{Tengwar|aU7UyE6}}</small> '''curuvar''', <small>{{Tengwar|aU7UyEu\}}</small> '''curuvard'''- "(good) wizard"
:<small>{{Tengwar|j#j#6}}</small> '''lalar''', <small>{{Tengwar|j#j#u\}}</small> '''lalard'''- "laughter"
:<small>{{Tengwar|j~CyR`C6}}</small> '''lávëar''', <small>{{Tengwar|j~CyR`Cu\}}</small> '''lávëard'''- "glutton"
:<small>{{Tengwar|t~Ct#6}}</small> '''mámar''', <small>{{Tengwar|t~Ct#u\}}</small> '''mámard'''- "sheperd"
:<small>{{Tengwar|t#6}}</small> '''mar''', <small>{{Tengwar|t#u\}}</small> '''mard'''- "grit"
:<small>{{Tengwar|5#6}}</small> '''nar''', <small>{{Tengwar|5#u\}}</small> '''nard'''- "odour, fragrance"
:<small>{{Tengwar|5Ì#6}}</small> '''nyar''', <small>{{Tengwar|5Ì#u\}}</small> '''nyard'''- "tale, saying"
:<small>{{Tengwar|qEj#iD6}}</small> '''palasar''', <small>{{Tengwar|qEj#iDu\}}</small> '''palasard'''- "great table"
:<small>{{Tengwar|iD6}}</small> '''sar''', <small>{{Tengwar|iDu\}}</small> '''sard'''- "pebble"
:<small>{{Tengwar|1Ej#6}}</small> '''talar''', <small>{{Tengwar|1Ej#u\}}</small> '''talard'''- "beast of burden"
:<small>{{Tengwar|1ÎU6}}</small> '''tyur''', <small>{{Tengwar|1ÎUu\}}</small> '''tyurd'''- "cheese"
:<small>{{Tengwar|t&j}}</small> '''mul''', <small>{{Tengwar|t&m\}}</small> '''muld'''- "powder"
:<small>{{Tengwar|5#j}}</small> '''nal''', <small>{{Tengwar|5#m\}}</small> '''nald'''- "dell, dale"
:<small>{{Tengwar|5$j1Tj}}</small> '''neltil''', <small>{{Tengwar|5$j1Tm\}}</small> '''neltild'''- "triangle"
:<small>{{Tengwar|5%zF1Tj}}</small> '''niquetil''', <small>{{Tengwar|5%zF1Tm\}}</small> '''niquetild'''- "snow-cap"
:<small>{{Tengwar|1Rj}}</small> '''tel''', <small>{{Tengwar|1Rm\}}</small> '''teld'''- "roof"
:<small>{{Tengwar|1ÎRj}}</small> '''tyel''', <small>{{Tengwar|1ÎRm\}}</small> '''tyeld'''- "end"
:<small>{{Tengwar|yTj}}</small> '''vil''', <small>{{Tengwar|yTm\}}</small> '''vild'''- "matter, business"
:<small>{{Tengwar|nTsTj}}</small> '''wingil''', <small>{{Tengwar|nTsTm\}}</small> '''wingild'''- "nymph"
There are also a few proper names with such stem-forms:
::<small>{{Tengwar|j.D7Rj%5}}</small> '''Laurelin''', <small>{{Tengwar|j~N7T`V5}}</small> '''Lórien''', <small>{{Tengwar|iYj^5$j}}</small> '''Solonel''',
::<small>{{Tengwar|1E5%zF1TTj}}</small> '''Taniquetil''', <small>{{Tengwar|`Cf#j%t^5}}</small> '''Ancalimon''', <small>{{Tengwar|8.D7Y5}}</small> '''Sauron'''.
=='''t'''-stems== :<small>{{Tengwar|`N7Y5}}</small> '''oron''', <small>{{Tengwar|`N7Y4\}}</small> '''oront'''- "mountain"
:<small>{{Tengwar|`Cw#6}}</small> '''ambar''', <small>{{Tengwar|`Cw#61\}}</small> '''ambart'''- "doom"
:<small>{{Tengwar|`Mw#6}}</small> '''umbar''', <small>{{Tengwar|`Mw#61\}}</small> '''umbart'''- "fate"
:<small>{{Tengwar|lD8}}</small> '''ais''', <small>{{Tengwar|lD81\}}</small> '''aist'''- "good name"
:<small>{{Tengwar|`Cj#8}}</small> '''alas''', <small>{{Tengwar|`Cj#81\}}</small> '''alast'''- "marble"
:<small>{{Tengwar|aDj#7U8}}</small> '''calarus''', <small>{{Tengwar|aDj#7U81\}}</small> '''calarust'''- "copper"
:<small>{{Tengwar|aG7T8}}</small> '''ciris''', <small>{{Tengwar|aG7T81\}}</small> '''cirist'''- "cleft, crack"
:<small>{{Tengwar|alYt#8}}</small> '''coimas''', <small>{{Tengwar|alYt#81\}}</small> '''coimast'''- "lembas" <ref name="coimas">also has the stem-form <small>{{Tengwar|alYt#,\}}</small> '''coimass'''-.</ref>
:<small>{{Tengwar|9Y8}}</small> '''hos''', <small>{{Tengwar|9Y81\}}</small> '''host'''- "folk, people"
:<small>{{Tengwar|`BzG8}}</small> '''iquis''', <small>{{Tengwar|`BzG81\}}</small> '''iquist'''- "requirement"
:<small>{{Tengwar|jlD7U8}}</small> '''lairus''', <small>{{Tengwar|jlD7U81\}}</small> '''lairust'''- "verdigris"
:<small>{{Tengwar|j%zG8}}</small> '''liquis''', <small>{{Tengwar|j%zG81\}}</small> '''liquist'''- "transparence, clarity"
:<small>{{Tengwar|j%8}}</small> '''lis''', <small>{{Tengwar|j%81\}}</small> '''list'''- "grace, blessing"
:<small>{{Tengwar|t#a<nowiki>|</nowiki>Gj%8}}</small> '''maxilis''', <small>{{Tengwar|t#a<nowiki>|</nowiki>Gj%81\}}</small> '''maxilist'''- "lordship"
:<small>{{Tengwar|t%8}}</small> '''mis''', <small>{{Tengwar|t%81\}}</small> '''mist'''- "urine"
:<small>{{Tengwar|5.D8}}</small> '''naus''', <small>{{Tengwar|5.D81\}}</small> '''naust'''- "suspicion"
:<small>{{Tengwar|5$8}}</small> '''nes''', <small>{{Tengwar|5$81\}}</small> '''nest'''- "food, feed, fodder"
:<small>{{Tengwar|5%`V6nR8}}</small> '''nierwes''', <small>{{Tengwar|5%`V6nR81\}}</small> '''nierwest'''- "hive"
:<small>{{Tengwar|5&8}}</small> '''nus''', <small>{{Tengwar|5&81\}}</small> '''nust'''- "smell"
:<small>{{Tengwar|5Ì#8}}</small> '''nyas''', <small>{{Tengwar|5Ì#81\}}</small> '''nyast'''- "scratch, score"
:<small>{{Tengwar|`N8}}</small> '''os''', <small>{{Tengwar|`N81\}}</small> '''ost'''- "cottage"
:<small>{{Tengwar|qU8}}</small> '''pus''', <small>{{Tengwar|qU81\}}</small> '''pust'''- "boil"
:<small>{{Tengwar|1T7T`N8}}</small> '''tirios''', <small>{{Tengwar|1T7T`N81\}}</small> '''tiriost'''- "walled town, burg"
:<small>{{Tengwar|`M7U8}}</small> '''urus''', <small>{{Tengwar|`M7U81\}}</small> '''urust'''- "redcopper"
<references />
The proper names in this group are:
:<small>{{Tengwar|1U7Ew#6}}</small> '''Turambar''', <small>{{Tengwar|t#2^8}}</small> '''Mandos'''.
----

revision.comment: Inclusion of Quenya mode Tengwar alongside Quenya written in the Latin alphabet. Many 'Qenya' words used, will consider later revision.
revision.text:
==Words with misguiding final letter== Following words look as words on {{Tengwar|\6}} -'''r''' but they are in fact words on {{Tengwar|\8}} -'''s''': ::{{Tengwar|a~C6}} '''cár''' → {{Tengwar|aD8\}} '''cas'''- "head" ::{{Tengwar|aY6}} '''cor''' → {{Tengwar|aY8\}} '''cos'''- "war" ::{{Tengwar|eD2^6}} '''fandor''' → {{Tengwar|eD2^8\}} '''fandos'''- "monster" ::{{Tengwar|t#6}} '''mar''' → {{Tengwar|t#8\}} '''mas'''- "home, dwelling" ::{{Tengwar|5%`V6}} '''nier''' → {{Tengwar|5%`V8\}} '''nies'''- "honey-bee" They only have a final {{Tengwar|\6}} -'''r''' in the nominative singular, in all other cases they are declined as {{Tengwar|aY8}} '''cos''' (see [[../Declension Paradigms/]]). And these words look as words on {{Tengwar|\8}} -'''s''' but they are really words on {{Tengwar|\1}} -'''t''': ::{{Tengwar|aF7R8}} '''ceres''' → {{Tengwar|aF7R1\}} '''ceret'''- "earthenware" ::{{Tengwar|9R8}} '''hes''' → {{Tengwar|9R1\}} '''het'''- "sibling" ::{{Tengwar|qEj%8}} '''palis''' → {{Tengwar|qEj%1\}} '''palit'''- "sward, lawn" They only have a final {{Tengwar|\8}} -'''s''' in the nominative singular, in all other cases they are declined as {{Tengwar|iD7E1}} '''sarat''' (see [[../Declension Paradigms/]]). ==Doubled '''t'''-stems== ===doubled stems in '''ts'''=== When these words end in {{Tengwar|\1}} -'''t''' we don’t find a genuine doubling but rather an extra {{Tengwar|\8}} -'''s''': ::{{Tengwar|9Rj$1}} '''helet''' → {{Tengwar|9Rj$1+\}} '''helets'''- "fur-coat" ::{{Tengwar|9R5$1}} '''henet''' → {{Tengwar|9R5$1+\}} '''henets'''- "window" ::{{Tengwar|`N7Y1}} '''orot''' → {{Tengwar|`N7Y1+\}} '''orots'''- "cave" ::{{Tengwar|zFj$1}} '''quelet''' → {{Tengwar|zFj$1+\}} '''quelets'''- "corpse" Also some words in {{Tengwar|\8}} -'''s''' belong to this group: ::{{Tengwar|`C7T8}} '''aris''' → {{Tengwar|`C7T1+\}} '''arits'''- "daughter" ::{{Tengwar|aDs#7T8}} '''cangaris''' → {{Tengwar|aDs#7T1+\}} '''cangarits'''- "weaver" ::{{Tengwar|eD8}} '''fas''' → {{Tengwar|eD1+\}} '''fats'''- "tassel" ::{{Tengwar|5^8}} '''nos''' → {{Tengwar|5^1+\}} '''nots'''- "damp" ::{{Tengwar|`H`C7T8}} '''oaris''' → {{Tengwar|`H`C7T1+\}} '''oarits'''- "mermaid" And one exceptional word in {{Tengwar|\`V}} -'''ë''': ::{{Tengwar|yT1R}} '''vitë''' → {{Tengwar|yT1+\}} '''vits'''- "sap" These words have a special locative and possessive singular, and they all have a u-dual:
singular plural dual part. plural
nominative {{Tengwar|9Rj$1}}
helet		 {{Tengwar|9Rj$1T+}}
heletsi		 {{Tengwar|9Rj$1U+}}
heletsu		 {{Tengwar|9Rj$1iRj%}}
heletseli
genitive {{Tengwar|9Rj$1Y+}}
heletso		 {{Tengwar|9Rj$1iG`N5}}
heletsion		 {{Tengwar|9Rj$1iJ`N}}
heletsuo		 {{Tengwar|9Rj$1iRj%`N5}}
heletselion
possessive {{Tengwar|9Rj$1nE}}
heletwa		 {{Tengwar|9Rj$1iGyE}}
heletsiva		 {{Tengwar|9Rj$1iJyE}}
heletsuva		 {{Tengwar|9Rj$1iRj~ByE}}
heletselíva
dative {{Tengwar|9Rj$1iR5}}
heletsen		 {{Tengwar|9Rj$1iG5}}
heletsin		 {{Tengwar|9Rj$1iJ5}}
heletsun		 {{Tengwar|9Rj$1iRj%5}}
heletselin
ablative {{Tengwar|9Rj$1iRj°^}}
heletsello		 {{Tengwar|9Rj$1iGj°^5 ›6›}}
heletsillon(r)		 {{Tengwar|9Rj$1iJj°^}}
heletsullo		 {{Tengwar|9Rj$1iRj%j°^ ›5 - 6›}}
heletselillo(n)(r)
allative {{Tengwar|9Rj$1iR5:#}}
heletsenna		 {{Tengwar|9Rj$1iG5:#6}}
heletsinnar		 {{Tengwar|9Rj$1iJ5:#}}
heletsunna		 {{Tengwar|9Rj$1iRj%5:# ›6›}}
heletselinna(r)
locative {{Tengwar|9Rj$1R+}}
heletsë		 {{Tengwar|9Rj$1iG,R5}}
heletsissen		 {{Tengwar|9Rj$1iJ,R}}
heletsussë		 {{Tengwar|9Rj$1iRj%,R ›5›}}
heletselisse(n)
instrumental {{Tengwar|9Rj$1iR5$5}}
heletsenen		 {{Tengwar|9Rj$1iG5$5}}
heletsinen		 {{Tengwar|9Rj$1iJ5$5}}
heletsunen		 {{Tengwar|9Rj$1iRj~B5$5}}
heletselínen
respective {{Tengwar|9Rj$1iR8}}
heletses		 {{Tengwar|9Rj$1iG8}}
heletsis		 {{Tengwar|9Rj$1iJ8}}
heletsus		 {{Tengwar|9Rj$1iRj%8}}
heletselis
===doubled stems in '''tt'''=== ::{{Tengwar|aDj&t$1}} '''calumet''' → {{Tengwar|aDj&t$1;\}} '''calumett'''- "lamp" ::{{Tengwar|aFd1RaF1}} '''cehtecet''' → {{Tengwar|aFd1RaF1;\}} '''cehtecett'''- "cuckling" ::{{Tengwar|j#1}} '''lat''' → {{Tengwar|j#1;\}} '''latt'''-, "flap, lid" ::{{Tengwar|j$zF1}} '''lequet''' → {{Tengwar|j$zF1;\}} '''lequett'''- "joint" ::{{Tengwar|t#1}} '''mat''' → {{Tengwar|t#1;\}} '''matt'''- "meal" ::{{Tengwar|5#1}} '''nat''' → {{Tengwar|5#1;\}} '''natt'''- "thing" ::{{Tengwar|1RaF1}} '''tecet''' → {{Tengwar|1RaF1;\}} '''tecett'''- "letter" ===doubled stems in '''ht'''=== ::{{Tengwar|aFaF1}} '''cecet''' → {{Tengwar|aFaFd1\}} '''ceceht'''- "pheasant" ::{{Tengwar|t$1}} '''met''' → {{Tengwar|t$d1\}} '''meht'''- "mark, aim" ::{{Tengwar|t&1}} '''mut''' → {{Tengwar|t&d1\}} '''muht'''- "dirt, filth" ::{{Tengwar|iD7E1}} '''sarat''' → {{Tengwar|iD7Ed1\}} '''saraht'''- "plank" ::{{Tengwar|1R7R1}} '''teret''' → {{Tengwar|1R7Rd1\}} '''tereht'''- "auger, gimlet" ::{{Tengwar|1R1}} '''tet''' → {{Tengwar|1Rd1\}} '''teht'''- "spot, mark" ::{{Tengwar|nRj$1}} '''welet''' → {{Tengwar|nRj$d1\}} '''weleht'''- "boil, tumour" ::{{Tengwar|hÍE1}} '''yat''' → {{Tengwar|hÍEd1\}} '''yaht'''- "neck" ==Vowel shortening== In some nouns a long vowel is shortened in the stem-form, but otherwise they are declined as if they didn't have that long vowel in the nominative singular. ::{{Tengwar|j~C6}} '''lár''' → {{Tengwar|j#6\}} '''lar'''- "ear" ::{{Tengwar|5~V5}} '''nén''' → {{Tengwar|5$5\}} '''nen'''- "water" ::{{Tengwar|5~V6}} '''nér''' → {{Tengwar|5$6\}} '''ner'''- "man" ::{{Tengwar|z~V5}} '''quén''' → {{Tengwar|zF5\}} '''quen'''- "person" ::{{Tengwar|1~Cj}} '''tál''' → {{Tengwar|1Ej\}} '''tal'''- "foot" ::{{Tengwar|hÍ~C6}} '''yár''' → {{Tengwar|hÍE6\}} '''yar'''- "blood" ^ ^ The normal word for blood is {{Tengwar|iR6aF}} '''sercë'''. The word {{Tengwar|hÍ~V5}} '''yén''' "Elvish year" is an exception, as its stem-form also has a long {{Tengwar|~V}} '''é''': {{Tengwar|hÍ~V5%}} '''yéni'''. ==Vowel lengthening== In a few words we find the reverse situation. But they are all proper names: ::{{Tengwar|`V7U9G5}} '''Eruhin''' → {{Tengwar|`V7U9~B5\}} '''Eruhín'''- "Child of Eru" ::{{Tengwar|yEj#1E6}} '''Valatar''' → {{Tengwar|yEj#1~C6\}} '''Valatár'''- "Valar-king" ::{{Tengwar|`C1E5#1E6}} '''Atanatar''' → {{Tengwar|`C1E5#1~C6\}} '''Atanatár'''- "Forefather" ::{{Tengwar|aDiD6}} '''Casar''' → {{Tengwar|aD8~C6\}} '''Casár'''- "Dwarf" ==Vowel changing== In some words the vowel completely changes. The most frequent words are the [[Quenya/U-stems|U-stems]] and the [[Quenya/I-stems|I-stems]]. There are 2 words that have a stem-forms in {{Tengwar|\`C}} –'''a''' but a nominative in {{Tengwar|\`N}} –'''o''': ::{{Tengwar|7.DaY}} '''rauco''' → {{Tengwar|7.DaD\}} '''rauca'''- "demon" ::{{Tengwar|iJ2^}} '''sundo''' → {{Tengwar|iJ2#\}} '''sunda'''- "root" Note: {{Tengwar|7.DaY}} '''rauco''' is in singular and dual a U-stem. There are also 2 words on {{Tengwar|\`C\}} –'''a''' with a stem-form on {{Tengwar|\`B\}} –'''i''': ::{{Tengwar|9~B5#}} '''hína''' → {{Tengwar|9~B5%\}} '''híni'''- "child" ::{{Tengwar|~N5^5#}} '''ónona''' → {{Tengwar|~N5^5%\}} '''ónoni'''- "twin" ==Words with exceptional connecting vowels== As we have seen: when a case-ending that begins with a consonant, is applied to a noun ending in a consonant we add an {{Tengwar|\`V\}} –'''e'''– between the stem and the ending, e.g. ::{{Tengwar|t#aGj$5}} '''macilen''' "to a sword" (dative) ::{{Tengwar|`C5#7R5:#}} '''anarenna''' "to a king" (allative) There are however four words that have a different connecting vowel: With {{Tengwar|\`N\}} –'''o'''– ::{{Tengwar|1Yj}} '''tol''' → {{Tengwar|1Yj°\}} '''toll'''- "island" ::{{Tengwar|t#2^8}} '''Mandos''' → {{Tengwar|t#2^81\}} '''Mandost'''- "Mandos" :so we find e.g. ::{{Tengwar|1Yj^,R}} '''tolossë''' "on an island" (locative) ::{{Tengwar|t#2^81Y5:#}} '''Mandostonna''' "to Mandos" (allative) With {{Tengwar|\`C\}} –'''a'''– ::{{Tengwar|1~Cj}} '''tál''' → {{Tengwar|1Ej\}} '''tal'''- "foot" ::{{Tengwar|`Mw#6}} '''umbar''' → {{Tengwar|`Mw#61\}} '''umbart'''- "fate" :so we find e.g. ::{{Tengwar|1Ej#5}} '''talan''' "to a foot" (dative) ::{{Tengwar|`Mw#61E5$5}} '''umbartanen''' "with fate" (instrumental) ==Irregular stem-forms== First a group of connected words: All words that denote a "room" end on {{Tengwar|\iD5}} –'''san'''. This is derived from {{Tengwar|iDw$}} '''sambë''' "room", e.g.: ::{{Tengwar|alDt#iD5}} '''caimasan''' → {{Tengwar|alDt#iDw\}} '''caimasamb'''- "bedroom" These two words also belong to this group: ::{{Tengwar|9C5}} '''han''' → {{Tengwar|9Cw\}} '''hamb'''- "ground" ::{{Tengwar|iD5}} '''san''' → {{Tengwar|iDw\}} '''samb'''- "chamber" But some words are totally irregular: ::{{Tengwar|aGj#qT}} '''cilapi''' → {{Tengwar|aGj#qTf\}} '''cilapinc'''- "robin" ::{{Tengwar|9ÍC6}} '''hyar''' → {{Tengwar|9ÍC6t\}} '''hyarm'''- "plough" ::{{Tengwar|j#8}} '''las''' → {{Tengwar|j#a|\}} '''lax'''- "snare" ::{{Tengwar|j$f$}} '''lencë''' → {{Tengwar|j$z\}} '''lenqu'''- "limb" ::{{Tengwar|lY1Y}} '''oito''' → {{Tengwar|lY`H4\}} '''oiont'''- "lack" ::{{Tengwar|`Nj^8}} '''olos''' → {{Tengwar|`Nj^6\}} '''olor'''- "dream" ::{{Tengwar|qE1}} '''pat''' → {{Tengwar|qEq1\}} '''papt'''- "small leaf" ::{{Tengwar|qRj1E8}} '''peltas''' → {{Tengwar|qRj1Ea|\}} '''peltax'''- "pivot" ::{{Tengwar|qT`V1}} '''piet''' → {{Tengwar|qT`Va;\}} '''piecc'''- "pin" ::{{Tengwar|iD1}} '''sat''' → {{Tengwar|iGq1\}} '''sapt'''- "hole" ::{{Tengwar|iGj%1}} '''silit''' → {{Tengwar|iGj%z\}} '''siliqu'''- "flint" ::{{Tengwar|iGf$}} '''sincë''' → {{Tengwar|iGv\}} '''sinqu'''- "mineral, metal" ::{{Tengwar|1D7E5}} '''taran''' → {{Tengwar|1E7Ew\}} '''taramb'''- "buffet" ::{{Tengwar|1Rj%5}} '''telin''' → {{Tengwar|1Rj%w\}} '''telimb'''- "roof, covering" ::{{Tengwar|1ÎU8}} '''tyus''' → {{Tengwar|1ÎUa|\}} '''tyux'''- "cud" ::{{Tengwar|`Mj&5}} '''ulun''' → {{Tengwar|`Mj&r\}} '''ulump'''- "camel" Some words resemble [[../2-letter words/]], but they have a stem-form: ::{{Tengwar|7~C}} '''rá''' → {{Tengwar|7~Cy\}} '''ráv'''- "lion" ::{{Tengwar|5~N}} '''nó''' → {{Tengwar|5~Nn\}} '''nów'''- "idea" ::{{Tengwar|1~N}} '''tó''' → {{Tengwar|1~Nn\}} '''tów'''- "wool" The possessive singular of these words always ends on -'''va''', the genitive on -'''vo''': ::{{Tengwar|7~C}} '''rá''' → {{Tengwar|7~CyE - 7~CyY}} '''ráva''', '''rávo''' ::{{Tengwar|5~N}} '''nó''' → {{Tengwar|5~NyE - 5~NyY}} '''nóva''', '''nóvo''' ::{{Tengwar|1~N}} '''tó''' → {{Tengwar|1~NyE - 1~NyY}} '''tóva''', '''tóvo''' {{Tengwar|}} ---- >> [[Neo-Quenya]] >> [[../Nouns/]] >> [[../Stem-forms/]] >> [[../Exceptional stems/]] {{BookCat}}

revision.comment: Inclusion of Quenya mode Tengwar alongside Quenya written in the Latin alphabet. Removal of duals, clashes with phonological rules, usage of u-duals seem to concern natural pairs, such as body parts & relational pairs.
revision.text:
==Nouns in -'''ë''' with plural on -'''er'''== This group only contains four nouns: {{Tengwar|t#j°$}} '''mallë''' "street", {{Tengwar|7Y1R+}} '''rotsë''' "pipe", {{Tengwar|1Î~CyR}} '''tyávë''' "taste", {{Tengwar|1ÎRj°$}} '''tyellë''' "grade". All nouns have t-duals, no u-duals are possible. They are declined as follows (we use {{Tengwar|t#j°$}} '''mallë''' "street"):

Some I-stems have a completely irregular nominative singular: ::{{Tengwar|j#qE1;R}} '''lapattë''', {{Tengwar|j#qE1T+\}} '''lapatsi'''- "rabbit" ::{{Tengwar|t#d1R}} '''mahtë''', {{Tengwar|t#a|G\}} '''maxi'''- "hold, grip" ::{{Tengwar|`Nd1R}} '''ohtë''', {{Tengwar|`Na|G\}} '''oxi'''- "egg" ::{{Tengwar|iUd1R}} '''suhtë''', {{Tengwar|iUa|G\}} '''suxi'''- "resin, gum" A few remarks: * The noun {{Tengwar|`Vd1R}} '''ehtë''' "spear" can be inflected as an I-stem or as a noun without I-stem. * The noun {{Tengwar|j%x$}} '''lingwë''' "fish" has an alternative nominative singular {{Tengwar|j%5nR}} '''linwë'''. All other cases are formed with the stem {{Tengwar|j%x%\}} '''lingwi'''-. * The adjectives in {{Tengwar|\`V}} –'''ë''' also belong to the I-stems, but one can only notice this when the adjective takes case endings (see [[../Inflected adjectives/]]). ==Nouns in -'''i'''== These nouns mostly denote female persons or animals (we use '''lopsi''' "mare"):

The u-duals in this group are declined as follows (we use {{Tengwar|`N2^}} '''ondo''' "stone"): ::Nom. {{Tengwar|`N2&}} '''ondu''' ::Gen. {{Tengwar|`N2&`N}} '''onduo''' ::Poss. {{Tengwar|`N2&yE}} '''onduva''' ::Dat. {{Tengwar|`N2&5}} '''ondun''', ::Abl. {{Tengwar|`N2&j°^}} '''ondullo''' ::All. {{Tengwar|`N2&5:#}} '''ondunna''' ::Loc. {{Tengwar|`N2&,F}} '''ondussë''' ::Instr. {{Tengwar|`N2&5$5}} '''ondunen''' ::Resp. {{Tengwar|`N2&8}} '''ondus'''. ==Nouns in -'''u''' that keep -'''u''' in all cases== There also exist words that end in the nominative in {{Tengwar|\`M}} –'''u''', these are however not U-stems. They differ from the U-stems in the nominative and the genitive plural. They also always have a t-dual. They are declined as follows (we use {{Tengwar|9R7U}} '''heru''' "lord"):

==Nouns in -'''o''' with a U-stem== These are the real U-stems. But there are two exceptional categories: the nouns in {{Tengwar|\aH}} -'''co''' and the nouns in {{Tengwar|\s^}} -'''ngo'''. The others are declined as follows (we use {{Tengwar|t#j^}} '''malo''', {{Tengwar|t#j&\}} '''malu'''- "pollen"). The u-duals in this group are declined as follows (we use {{Tengwar|iG1Y}} '''sito''', {{Tengwar|iG1U\}} '''situ'''- "habit"): ::Nom. {{Tengwar|iG1U}} '''situ''' ::Gen. {{Tengwar|iG1U`N}} '''situo''' ::Poss. {{Tengwar|iG1UyE}} '''situva''' ::Dat. {{Tengwar|iG1U5}} '''situn''' ::Abl. {{Tengwar|iG1Uj°^}} '''situllo''' ::All. {{Tengwar|iG1U5:#}} '''situnna''' ::Loc. {{Tengwar|iG1U,F}} '''situssë''' ::Instr. {{Tengwar|iG1U5$5}} '''situnen''' ::Resp. {{Tengwar|iG1U8}} '''situs'''. Note that these forms are, except for the nominative, all equal to the singular. The noun {{Tengwar|1U`N}} '''tuo''' "muscle" behaves rather strangely because its Old-Elvish stem was {{Tengwar|1~M`M\}} '''''túu'''''-. This long {{Tengwar|~M}} '''ú''' appears when the ending begins in a single consonant; when the ending starts in a consonant cluster or a vowel, we find {{Tengwar|`M}} '''u''' instead of {{Tengwar|~M}} '''ú''', e.g. ::Dative singular: {{Tengwar|1~M5}} '''tún''' ::Ablative singular: {{Tengwar|1Uj°^}} '''tullo''' ===U-stems in -'''co'''=== The special feature here is that the combination {{Tengwar|aJ`B}} '''cui''' changes in {{Tengwar|zG}} '''qui'''. As an example we look at {{Tengwar|`M6aH}} '''urco''', {{Tengwar|`M6aJ\}} '''urcu'''- "bogey":

The u-duals are just as in the example of {{Tengwar|iG1Y}} '''sito''', except for the nominative, all equal to the singular. Two nouns behave irregularly: * {{Tengwar|7.DaH}} '''rauco''' "demon" is only a U-stem in the singular, partitive plural and dual. The plural is formed with the stem {{Tengwar|7.DaD\}} '''rauca'''-. * {{Tengwar|1RjaH}} '''telco''' "leg, stem" is only a U-stem in the plural and the dual. The singular and partitive plural are formed with the stem {{Tengwar|1RjaH\}} '''telco'''- (see above for nouns that end in {{Tengwar|\`N}} -'''o'''). ===U-stems in -'''go'''=== The special feature here is that the combination {{Tengwar|s&}} '''ngu''' + {{Tengwar|`B}} '''i''' changes in {{Tengwar|x%}} '''ngwi'''. As an example we look at {{Tengwar|`Cs^}} '''ango''', {{Tengwar|`Cs&\}} '''angu'''- "snake":
singular plural dual part. plural
nominative {{Tengwar|`Cs^}}

revision.comment: Spacing for Tengwar and Tengwar revision.
revision.text:
Neo-Quenya has a number of words that end in a long vowel, but they all have only two letters: ::{{Tengwar|t~C}} '''má''' "hand" ::{{Tengwar|z~C}} '''quá''' "duck" ::{{Tengwar|q~V}} '''pé''' "lip" ::{{Tengwar|7~V}} '''ré''' "day (of 24 hours)" ::{{Tengwar|5Ì~V}} '''nyé''' "bleat" ::{{Tengwar|e~V}} '''fé''' "last hour" ::{{Tengwar|8~V}} '''sé''' "eyeball" ::{{Tengwar|1Î~V}} '''tyé''' "tea" ::{{Tengwar|q~B}} '''pí''' "fly, insect" ::{{Tengwar|9~N}} '''hó''' "owl" ::{{Tengwar|a~M}} '''cú''' "crescent, arc" ::{{Tengwar|j~M}} '''lú''' "moment" ::{{Tengwar|8~M}} '''sú''' "rushing (of the wind)" and the proper names {{Tengwar|y~V}} '''Vé''' and {{Tengwar|7~M}} '''Rú'''. The following words also have this form, but in Neo-Quenya they sound old-fashioned, so they are replaced most of the time with the word next to them: ::{{Tengwar|a~C}} '''cá''' "jaw" → {{Tengwar|`Cf#}} '''anca''' ::{{Tengwar|7~C}} '''rá''' "arm" → {{Tengwar|7Ef^}} '''ranco''' ::{{Tengwar|j~N}} '''ló''' "night" → {{Tengwar|j~Nt$}} '''lómë''' ::{{Tengwar|e~C}} '''fá''' "air, atmosphere" → {{Tengwar|nTjnD - yTjnE}} '''wilwa / vilwa''' ::{{Tengwar|5~B}} '''ní''' "woman" → {{Tengwar|5~B8}} '''nís''' ::{{Tengwar|8~C}} '''sá''' "fire" → {{Tengwar|`M7U}} '''uru''' ::{{Tengwar|n~C}} '''wá''' "wind" → {{Tengwar|ylDnE}} '''vaiwa''' ::{{Tengwar|hÎ~N}} '''yó''' "son" → {{Tengwar|hÎY2^}} '''yondo''' The words {{Tengwar|7~C}} '''rá''' "lion", {{Tengwar|1~N}} '''tó''' "wool" and {{Tengwar|5~N}} '''nó''' "idea" don't belong to this category because they have a stem-form with 3 letters (see [[../Exceptional stems/]]). They have some special features: * When the case ending contains a double consonant, the vowel is shortened: ::{{Tengwar|7R,R}} '''ressë''' "on a day" (locative) ::{{Tengwar|`B t#5:#6}} '''i mannar''' "to the hands" (allative) * In the u-duals the –'''u''' joins with the final vowel to make a diphthong: ::{{Tengwar|q.F}} '''peu''' "a pair of lips" * In the plural the –'''i'''- also joins with the final vowel: ::{{Tengwar|alU5$5}} '''cuinen''' "with arcs" (instrumental) ::{{Tengwar|tlDyE}} '''maiva''' "of hands" (possessive) * In the words ending with –'''é''', the diphthong '''ei''' is not a possible combination in Quenya. Instead, it is left as it is, having no distinction from singular/plural forms: ::{{Tengwar|7~V5}} '''rén''' "to a day/ to the days" (dative) :To further define the singular/plural difference if need be, numbers can be expressed to distinguish quantity of a noun: ::{{Tengwar|7~V5 `C1;E}} '''rén atta''' "to the two days" * The genitive singular is not known for most nouns. The words on -'''é''' don't give any problems because '''éo''' is acceptable: ::{{Tengwar|7~V}} '''ré''' "day" → {{Tengwar|7~V`N}} '''réo''' ::{{Tengwar|q~V}} '''pé''' "lip" → {{Tengwar|q~V`N}} '''péo''' :Those already with an {{Tengwar|\~N}} -'''ó''' have a genitive that is identical to the nominative. The complete declination for '''má''' "hand" can be found in next table:

It should be noted that irregular forms for noun declension appear to be frequent in two letter words, and careful consideration is to be taken to ensure no word clashes within the letter itself (such as diphthongs or long vowels before a consonant group, vowel combinations that don't exist, such as '''ei''') and with other attested words provided by Tolkien. As to demonstrate in the table below, the word {{Tengwar|q~V}} '''pé''' has has an another plural form {{Tengwar|q~V1T}} '''péti''', as attested by Tolkien, instead of pei which cannot be formed in Quenya. revision.comment: Inclusion of Quenya mode Tengwar alongside Quenya written in the Latin alphabet.
revision.text:
These are nouns that are constructed out of verbs.
The main types are:
1. The ending <small>{{Tengwar|\t$}}</small> -'''më''' is used for abstract things: :<small>{{Tengwar|t$j\}}</small> '''mel'''- "love" → <small>{{Tengwar|t$jt$}}</small> '''melmë''' "love" :<small>{{Tengwar|aD6\}}</small> '''car'''- "make, build, do" → <small>{{Tengwar|aD6t$}}</small> '''carmë''' "art"
2. The ending <small>{{Tengwar|\`B`V}}</small> -'''ië''' is used for a noun that indicates that the action is still going on: :<small>{{Tengwar|1ÎEj\}}</small> '''tyal'''- "play" → <small>{{Tengwar|1ÎEj%`V}}</small> '''tyalië''' "a play" :<small>{{Tengwar|qR7ÎD}}</small> '''perya'''- "halve" → <small>{{Tengwar|qR7T`V}}</small> '''perië''' "a halving"
3. Verbs on <small>{{Tengwar|\1E}}</small> -'''ta''' can be used as nouns without changing anything: :<small>{{Tengwar|yE4#}}</small> '''vanta'''- "walk" → <small>{{Tengwar|yE4#}}</small> '''vanta''' "a walk" :<small>{{Tengwar|j#4#}}</small> '''lanta'''- "fall" → <small>{{Tengwar|j#4#}}</small> '''lanta''' "a fall"
4. The ending <small>{{Tengwar|\`V}}</small> -'''ë''' together with a lengthened stem-vowel are used to make nouns that describe a consequence of the verb: :<small>{{Tengwar|iR6\}}</small> '''ser'''- "rest" → <small>{{Tengwar|8~V7R}}</small> '''sérë''' "peace" :<small>{{Tengwar|j%6\}}</small> '''lir'''- "sing" → <small>{{Tengwar|j~B7R}}</small> '''lírë''' "song"
5. To make nouns that denote concrete things we use the ending <small>{{Tengwar|\j$}}</small> -'''lë''' with A-verbs and U-verbs: :<small>{{Tengwar|5&61E\}}</small> '''nurta'''- "hide" → <small>{{Tengwar|5&61Ej$}}</small> '''nurtalë''' "a hiding" :<small>{{Tengwar|qR6yE}}</small> '''perya'''- "halve" → <small>{{Tengwar|qR6yEj$}}</small> '''peryalë''' "a half" :<small>{{Tengwar|5&7;U}}</small> '''nurru'''- "grumble" → <small>{{Tengwar|5&7;Uj$}}</small> '''nurrulë''' "a grumble"
and for primitive verbs we add <small>{{Tengwar|\`Cj$}}</small> -'''alë''' to the past tense stem: :<small>{{Tengwar|zR1\}}</small> '''quet'''- "talk" → <small>{{Tengwar|zR4#j$}}</small> '''quentalë''' "a story"
This fifth type of nouns is the type most frequently found.
To denote someone who performs an action we have the endings: <small>{{Tengwar|\7Y - \7R}}</small> -'''ro'''/-'''rë''' and <small>{{Tengwar|\`B2^ - \`B2$}}</small> -'''indo'''/-'''indë'''.
The endings on <small>{{Tengwar|\`N}}</small> -'''o''' are masculine, and those on <small>{{Tengwar|\`V}}</small> -'''ë''' are feminine.
The first two endings are applied to A-verbs and U-verbs: :<small>{{Tengwar|t#81E\}}</small> '''masta'''- "bake" ::<small>{{Tengwar|t#81E7Y}}</small> '''mastaro''' "baker" (m.) ::<small>{{Tengwar|t#81E7R}}</small> '''mastarë''' "baker" (f.)
and the other two to primitive verbs: :<small>{{Tengwar|aD6\}}</small> '''car'''- 'make, build, do" ::<small>{{Tengwar|aD7T2^}}</small> '''carindo''' "maker, builder" (m.) ::<small>{{Tengwar|aD7T2$}}</small> '''carindë''' "maker, builder" (f.)
Sometimes the ending <small>{{Tengwar|\7Y}}</small> -'''ro''' is replaced by the short form <small>{{Tengwar|\6}}</small> -'''r''', e.g. <small>{{Tengwar|`B81E6}}</small> '''istar''' "wizard" from <small>{{Tengwar|`B81E\}}</small> '''ista'''- "know".
To make the plurals of the masculine form on <small>{{Tengwar|}}</small> -'''ro''' I would personally always prefer this shortened form: :<small>{{Tengwar|t#81E7T}}</small> '''mastari''' instead of <small>{{Tengwar|t#81E7Y6}}</small> '''mastaror'''
===Usage of cases=== The connection of a verbal noun to a verb means that it is often a condensed sentence, so that is why such nouns can have a subject and an object: :<small>{{Tengwar|`Cj1E7T`Vj°^ 5lD5%`V}}</small> '''Altariello nainië''' "the lament of Galadriel"
We call this a subject genitive because Galadriel is the one who laments.
When a verbal noun has an object we use the possessive case: :<small>{{Tengwar|jlD1Ej$ `N7Yt~VyE}}</small> '''laitalë Oroméva''' "honoring of Orome" By this we mean that Orome is honoured, so it is the object of "honour", and this is called an object possessive.
Of course both can be present with the same verbal noun: :<small>{{Tengwar|`V7U`N t$jt$ `C1E5%yE}}</small> '''Eruo melmë ataniva''' "the love of God for men" (or, "God's love of men") :<small>{{Tengwar|`C1E5%`N5 t$jt$ `V7UyE}}</small> '''atanion melmë Eruva''' "the love of men for God" (or, "men's love of God")
----
>> [[Neo-Quenya]] >> [[../Nouns/]] >> [[../Verbal nouns/]]
{{BookCat}}

revision.comment: Spacing for Tengwar and additional info.
revision.text:
In Neo-Quenya the nominative case is used for: * the subject * the predicate * the direct object * after most prepositions :::(only <small>{{Tengwar|`V1 <nowiki>=</nowiki> `C6nE <nowiki>=</nowiki> 7~C <nowiki>=</nowiki> ~M}}</small> '''et''', '''arwa''', '''rá''' and '''ú''' take another case)
The nominative is the basic form that can be found in a dictionary. The plural, dual and partitive plural of this case can be found on the main page about [[../Nouns|nouns]].
The use of the nominative for the direct object has implications for the word order: :in a normal sentence the word order is <u>subject - verb - object</u>: ::<small>{{Tengwar|`B 5~V6 7lY1E `B 7Ya;Y}}</small> '''i nér roita i rocco''' "the man chases the horse"
::<small>{{Tengwar|`B 7Ya;Y 7lY1E `B 5~V6}}</small> '''i rocco roita i nér''' "the horse chases the man" All other parts of the sentence can be in any order: ::<small>{{Tengwar|`B `C7E5 `C4# 7Ya;Y `B 7YzF5$5}}</small> '''i aran anta rocco i roquenen''' "the king gives a horse to the knight"
::<small>{{Tengwar|`B `C7E5 `C4# `B 7YzF5$5 7Ya;Y}}</small> '''i aran anta i roquenen rocco''' "the king gives to the knight a horse"
::<small>{{Tengwar|`B `C7E5 `B 7YzF5$5 `C4# 7Ya;Y}}</small> '''i aran i roquenen anta rocco''' "the king, to the knight, gives a horse"
::<small>{{Tengwar|`B 7YzF5$5 `B `C7E5 `C4# 7Ya;Y}}</small> '''i roquenen i aran anta rocco''' "to the knight, the king gives a horse" It purely depends on the emphasis one likes to express.
===Accusative case=== In Book Quenya (this is an ancient precursor of Neo-Quenya) there existed a separate accusative case that was used for the direct object and after prepositions. But in the Quenya at the time of the Lord of the Rings this case had disappeared.
It was formed as follows: * when the nominative singular ends in a consonant, the accusative singular is identical to the nominative, the accusative plural ends in <small>{{Tengwar|\~B}}</small> -'''í''' * when the nominative singular ends in a vowel, this vowel is lengthened in the accusative singular, in the accusative plural we add <small>{{Tengwar|\`B}}</small> -'''i''' * but when the nominative singular ends in <small>{{Tengwar|`B}}</small> -'''i''' or <small>{{Tengwar|\`B`V}}</small> -'''ië''', the accusative plural ends in <small>{{Tengwar|\~B}}</small> -'''í''' * when the nominative dual ends in <small>{{Tengwar|`M}}</small> -'''u''', this <small>{{Tengwar|`M}}</small> '''u''' is lengthened to <small>{{Tengwar|~M}}</small> '''ú'''; when it ends in <small>{{Tengwar|\1}}</small> -'''t''', the Accusative dual is identical to the nominative dual * in the accusative partitive plural we always find <small>{{Tengwar|\~B}}</small> -'''í'''
<small>{{Tengwar|`Cm#}}</small> '''alda''' (tree) ::sing. <small>{{Tengwar|`Cm~C}}</small> '''aldá'''
::plural <small>{{Tengwar|`CmlD}}</small> '''aldai'''
::dual <small>{{Tengwar|`Cm~M}}</small> '''aldú'''
::part. plural <small>{{Tengwar|`Cm#j~B}}</small> '''aldalí'''
<small>{{Tengwar|t#aGj}}</small> '''macil''' (sword) ::sing. <small>{{Tengwar|t#aGj}}</small> '''macil'''
::plural <small>{{Tengwar|t#aGj~B}}</small> '''macilí'''
::dual <small>{{Tengwar|t#aGj$1}}</small> '''macilet'''
::part. plural <small>{{Tengwar|t#aGj°~B}}</small> '''macillí'''
<small>{{Tengwar|j%`V}}</small> '''lië''' (people) ::sing. <small>{{Tengwar|j%~V}}</small> '''lié'''
::plural <small>{{Tengwar|j~B}}</small> '''lí'''
::dual <small>{{Tengwar|j%`V1}}</small> '''liet'''
::part. plural <small>{{Tengwar|j%`Vj~B}}</small> '''lielí'''
----
>> [[Neo-Quenya]] >> [[../Nouns/]] >> [[../Nominative/]]
{{BookCat}}

revision.comment: Inclusion of Quenya mode Tengwar alongside Quenya written in the Latin alphabet.
revision.text:
Quenya has 2 cases that together form the traditional genitive case of an inflected language (e.g. Latin, German or Greek): the genitive and the [[../Possessive|possessive]]. So it is important to know when each is appropriate. ==Usage== There is quite an extensive list of situations in which the genitive is used: 1. origin The place where something is made or someone is born is in the genitive: ::{{Tengwar|aG7ÎE 1T7T`N5^}} '''cirya Tiriono''' "the ship of Tirion" ::{{Tengwar|iRm^ `CjzDj^2$`N}} '''seldo Alqualondëo''' "the boy from Swanhaven" It has no implication of movement, so the boy was born in Swanhaven but we don't mean that he just arrived from Swanhaven. 2. previous owner ::{{Tengwar|7Ya;Y `C7E5^}} '''rocco arano''' "the horse of a king" This means that the horse once belonged to the king, but now belongs to someone else. 3. partitive genitive We use this to denote something that is part of something greater: ::{{Tengwar|`B `Vj$5%`N5 `Cf#j%t#}} '''i elenion ancalima''' "the brightest of the stars" ::{{Tengwar|7Ev% `B `C7E5^}} '''ranqui i arano''' "the arms of the king" 4. family relations ::{{Tengwar|`B `C7E5^ hÍY2^6}} '''i arano yondor''' "the sons of the king" ::{{Tengwar|`B2%8 `N1E7Y}} '''indis ohtaro''' "the bride of a soldier" 5. where a title belongs to ::{{Tengwar|`C7E5 iG2#7Y5}} '''aran Sindaron''' "the king of the Sindar" ::{{Tengwar|9R7U `B aY6t#7Y5}} '''heru i cormaron''' "the lord of the rings" 6. nouns after "about" ::{{Tengwar|`VzR,T `C7E5^}} '''equessi arano''' "the sayings about the king" Frequently the preposition "about" is replaced by "of" in English, so we have to be careful about the meaning of this "of": ::{{Tengwar|`B 5.DaY6 zF1T6 `Cj1R 9D6t#7Y5}} '''i naucor quetir altë harmaron''' "the dwarves speak of (about) great treasures" ::{{Tengwar|zF4# iGjt#7Tj°%`N5}} '''quenta Silmarillion''' "the tale of (about) the Silmarils" ::{{Tengwar|zF4#j$ 5^m^7Y5}} '''quentalë Noldoron''' "the history of (about) the Noldor" (for more about this see also [[../Verbal nouns/]]) 7. composite names of plants or animals ::{{Tengwar|`CiR`C `C7E5%`N5}} '''asëa aranion''' "kings' weed" 8. the word following '''quanta''' "full" ::{{Tengwar|zD4# t#,Y}} '''quanta masso''' "full of bread" 9. the prepositions {{Tengwar|~M}} '''ú''' "without" and the adjective {{Tengwar|`C6nE}} '''arwa''' "with, having" ::{{Tengwar|~M aDj^}} '''ú calo''' "without light" ::{{Tengwar|`C7E5 `C6nE `Nd1E7T`N5}} '''aran arwa ohtarion''' "a king with/having soldiers" The adjective {{Tengwar|`C6nE}} '''arwa''' has the plural form of {{Tengwar|`C6nR}} '''arwë''', this is used when there is more than one owner: ::{{Tengwar|5$7T `C6nR aYj°^}} '''neri arwë collo''' "men with/having a mantle" ===Word order=== The genitive can be placed in front or behind the noun to which it belongs: ::{{Tengwar|`B 5~N7R`N `Cm#6}} '''i nórëo aldar''' "trees of the land" ::{{Tengwar|`Cm#6 `B 5~N7R`N}} '''aldar i nórëo''' "trees of the land" There are 2 cases in which the genitive is always put in front: * when the noun is preceded by a preposition: ::{{Tengwar|yR `N81Y `C7E5}} '''ve osto aran''' "like the king of a city" ::{{Tengwar|5& 1T7T5^ 1~NqE}} '''nu tirino tópa''' "under the roof of a tower" * when the noun has both a word in the genitive and in the possessive case: ::{{Tengwar|`B `Vm#7Y5 t#aGj `C1E6nE}} '''i eldaron macil atarwa''' "father's sword of (coming from) the elves" A genitive can also be used predicatively: ::{{Tengwar|`B aY6t# 5~C 8.D7Y2^}} '''i corma ná Saurondo''' "the ring is (originally) Sauron's" ===Use of the article=== A noun that is accompanied by a noun in the genitive case normally shouldn't get the article '''i''' (however the article is sometimes written for poetic reasons). So we have to take into account that a noun in the genitive can be translated with either an indefinite or a definite article: ::{{Tengwar|`B2%8 `Nd1E7Y}} '''indis ohtaro''' "a bride of a soldier"/"the bride of a soldier" ::{{Tengwar|`Nd1E7Y `B2%8}} '''ohtaro indis''' "a bride of a soldier"/"the bride of a soldier" ::{{Tengwar|`B `Nd1E7Y `B2%8}} '''i ohtaro indis''' "a bride of the soldier"/"the bride of the soldier" ::{{Tengwar|`B2%8 `B `Nd1E7Y}} '''indis i ohtaro''' "a bride of the soldier"/"the bride of the soldier" ==Formation== We discuss each of the numbers separately: ===Singular=== The basic ending is {{Tengwar|\`N}} -'''o'''. Most words simply add this ending: ::{{Tengwar|`C7E5}} '''aran''' "king" → {{Tengwar|`C7E5^}} '''arano''' ::{{Tengwar|1~C7T}} '''tári''' "queen" → {{Tengwar|1~C7T`N}} '''tário''' ::{{Tengwar|yR2$}} '''vendë''' "girl" → {{Tengwar|yR2$`N}} '''vendëo''' Words that have a stem-form use this stem-form: ::{{Tengwar|5~B8}} '''nís''' "woman" → {{Tengwar|5%,Y}} '''nisso''' (stem-form {{Tengwar|5%,\}} ''niss-'') ::{{Tengwar|aU7Y}} '''curo''' "device" → {{Tengwar|aU7U`N}} '''curuo''' (stem-form {{Tengwar|aU7U\}} ''curu-'') ::{{Tengwar|j~Nt$}} '''lómë''' "night" → {{Tengwar|j~Nt%`N}} '''lómio''' (stem-form {{Tengwar|j~Nt%\}} ''lómi-'') Words on {{Tengwar|\`N}} -'''o''' have a genitive singular that is identical to the nominative singular: ::{{Tengwar|7Ya;Y}} '''rocco''' "horse" → {{Tengwar|7Ya;Y}} '''rocco''' In words on {{Tengwar|\`C}} -'''a''' this final letter is replaced by {{Tengwar|\`N}} -'''o''': ::{{Tengwar|t~Ct#}} '''máma''' "sheep" → {{Tengwar|t~Ct^}} '''mámo''' Words on {{Tengwar|\`B`V}} -'''ië''' lengthen the final the "e" to make it {{Tengwar|\`B~V}} -'''ié''': ::{{Tengwar|t^65%`V}} '''mornië''' "darkness" → {{Tengwar|t^65%~V`N}} '''morniéo''' ::{{Tengwar|j%`V}} '''lië''' "people" → {{Tengwar|j%~V`N}} '''liéo''' ===Plural=== The plural adds {{Tengwar|\`N5}} -'''on''' to the nominative '''''plural''''' (this is exceptional as all other cases of the plural are based upon the nominative singular): ::{{Tengwar|`Cm#6}} '''aldar''' "trees" → {{Tengwar|`Cm#7Y5}} '''aldaron''' (nom.sing.: alda) ::{{Tengwar|`Vj$5%}} '''eleni''' "stars" → {{Tengwar|`Vj$5%`N5}} '''elenion''' (nom.sing.: elen) ::{{Tengwar|7~CyT}} '''rávi''' "lions" → {{Tengwar|7~CyT`N5}} '''rávion''' (nom.sing.: rá) ::{{Tengwar|5%,G}} '''nissi''' "women" → {{Tengwar|5%,T`N5}} '''nission''' (nom.sing.: nís) Words on {{Tengwar|\`B`V}} -'''ië''' lengthen the final "e" to {{Tengwar|\`B~V}} -'''ié''': ::{{Tengwar|t^65%`V}} '''mornië''' "darkness" → {{Tengwar|t^65%~V7Y5}} '''morniéron''' ::{{Tengwar|j%`V}} '''lië''' "people" → {{Tengwar|j%~V7Y5}} '''liéron''' ===Dual=== In the dual the ending is also {{Tengwar|\`N}} -'''o''': ::{{Tengwar|aG7ÎE1}} '''ciryat''' "a pair of ships" → {{Tengwar|aG7Î#1Y}} '''ciryato''' (nom.sing.: cirya) ::{{Tengwar|`Cm&}} '''aldu''' "a pair of trees" → {{Tengwar|`Cm&`N}} '''alduo''' (nom.sing.: alda) ::{{Tengwar|7~CyR1}} '''rávet''' "a pair of lions" → {{Tengwar|7~CyR1Y}} '''ráveto''' (nom.sing.: rá) When the noun has a t-dual and the nominative singular ends in a vowel followed by a consonant:
({{Tengwar|\j \5 \6 \8}} -'''l''', -'''n''', -'''r''', -'''s'''), the {{Tengwar|\`V\}} -'''e'''- of the nominative dual disappears in the genitive dual: ::{{Tengwar|`C7E5$1}} '''aranet''' "a pair of kings" → {{Tengwar|`C7E4^}} '''aranto''' (nom.sing.: aran) ::{{Tengwar|t#aGj$1}} '''macilet''' "a pair of swords" → {{Tengwar|t#aGj1Y}} '''macilto''' (nom.sing.: macil) ::{{Tengwar|`V`C7R1}} '''ëaret''' "a pair of seas" → {{Tengwar|`V`C61Y}} '''ëarto''' (nom.sing.: ëar) Words on {{Tengwar|\`B`V}} -'''ië''' lengthen the final "e" to make {{Tengwar|\`B~V}} -'''ié''': ::{{Tengwar|t^65%`V}} '''mornië''' "darkness" → {{Tengwar|t^65%~V1Y}} '''morniéto''' ::{{Tengwar|j%`V}} '''lië''' "people" → {{Tengwar|j%~V1Y}} '''liéto''' ===Partitive Plural=== We always add -'''on''' to the nominative partitive plural: ::{{Tengwar|aG7ÎEj%}} '''ciryali''' "some ships" → {{Tengwar|aG7ÎEj%`N5}} '''ciryalion''' (nom.sing.: {{Tengwar|aG7ÎE}} cirya) ---- >> [[Neo-Quenya]] >> [[../Nouns/]] >> [[../Genitive/]] {{BookCat}}

Neo-Quenya has 2 cases that together form the traditional genitive case of an inflected language (e.g. Latin, German or Greek): the [[../Genitive|genitive]] and the possessive.
So it is important to know when each is appropriate.
==Usage==
There are 4 situations in which the possessive is used:
1. present owner
:<small>{{Tengwar|7Ya;Y `B `C7E5nE}}</small> '''rocco <u>i aranwa</u>''' "the king's horse" This means that the horse at this moment belongs to the king. It has no implications of origin or previous ownership.
This is why in English this case is frequently translated by an English genitive.
Of course this ownership is always related to the tense of the verb: it is the present owner at the moment indicated by the verb: :<small>{{Tengwar|5#8 aY`C `B `Vm#yE}}</small> '''nas coa <u>i eldava</u>''' "it's the elf's house" So this house is at this moment the property of that elf. :<small>{{Tengwar|5$8 qE6t# `B yR2$yE}}</small> '''nes parma <u>i vendeva</u>''' "it was the book of the girl" In this case the girl was the present owner of the book at the moment of the sentence, but it is quite possible that at this moment she no longer owns it.
2. properties
The possessive case is also used to denote a property of a person or object: ::<small>{{Tengwar|9lU5$ `B 1.D7RyE}}</small> '''huinë <u>i taureva</u>''' "the gloom of the wood"
::<small>{{Tengwar|`Cj1E7R `B 5$6nE}}</small> '''altarë <u>i nerwa</u>''' "the length of the man"
3. substance
We also use this case to denote the substance from which something is made: :<small>{{Tengwar|7T`V 1RjqEyE}}</small> '''rië <u>telpeva</u>''' "the crown of silver" This meaning is of course related to using an adjective: :<small>{{Tengwar|`B 1RjqT5# 7T`V}}</small> '''i telpina rië''' "the silver crown" When we use a possessive case the material from which the crown is made is emphasized (just as can be seen by the English translations).
4. subject of nouns with an "about" noun
In situation 6 of the usage of the genitive case we have seen that the words after the preposition "about" are in the genitive. The subject of these words is however in the possessive case. This can again be translated by "of" but in this case "of" is equivalent to the preposition "by": ::<small>{{Tengwar|zR4#j$ `C1E6nE}}</small> '''quentalë <u>atarwa</u>''' "the story of (i.e. by) father"
::<small>{{Tengwar|`VzR,G `B 5.DalYyE}}</small> '''equessi <u>i naucoiva</u>''' "the sayings of (i.e. by) the dwarves" (for more about this see also [[../Verbal nouns/]])
===Word order=== The possessive is always put behind the noun to which it belongs: ::<small>{{Tengwar|t~B7T `B 5.DaYyE}}</small> '''míri <u>i naucova</u>''' "the dwarf's jewels"
::<small>{{Tengwar|1~C7T `B `VmlDyE}}</small> '''tári <u>i eldaiva</u>''' "the elves' queen"
A possessive can also be used predicatively: :<small>{{Tengwar|`B aY6t# 5~C 8.D7Y2$yE}}</small> '''i corma ná <u>Saurondeva</u>''' "the ring is Sauron's"
===Use of the article=== A noun that is accompanied by a noun in the possessive case normally shouldn't get the article '''i''' (however the article is sometimes written for poetic reasons).
So we have to take into account that a noun in the possessive can be translated with either an indefinite or a definite article: ::<small>{{Tengwar|aY`C `Nd1E6nE}}</small> '''coa <u>ohtarwa</u>''' "a house of a soldier"/"the house of a soldier"
::<small>{{Tengwar|aY`C `B `Nd1E6nE}}</small> '''coa <u>i ohtarwa</u>''' "a house of the soldier"/"the house of the soldier"
==Formation== We discuss each of the numbers separately:
===Singular=== The basic ending is <small>{{Tengwar|\hÎD}}</small> -'''va''' after vowels and <small>{{Tengwar|\nE}}</small> -'''wa''' after consonants.
Most words simply add this ending: ::<small>{{Tengwar|`Vm#}}</small> '''elda''' "elf" → <small>{{Tengwar|`Vm#yE}}</small> '''eldava'''
::<small>{{Tengwar|`C7E5}}</small> '''aran''' "king" → <small>{{Tengwar|`C7E5nE}}</small> '''aranwa'''
There are two important exceptions: * words that end on a vowel and of which the penultimate syllable is short (see [[../Phonology/]]), lengthen the final vowel before adding <small>{{Tengwar|\yE}}</small> -'''va''': ::<small>{{Tengwar|1ÎEj%`C}}</small> '''tyalië''' "play" → <small>{{Tengwar|1ÎEj%~VyE}}</small> '''tyaliéva'''
::<small>{{Tengwar|`N7Yt$}}</small> '''oromë''' "hornblower" → <small>{{Tengwar|`N7Yt~VyE}}</small> '''oroméva'''
::<small>{{Tengwar|1E5^}}</small> '''tano''' "crafstman" → <small>{{Tengwar|1E5~NyE}}</small> '''tanóva''' * words of two syllables that contain the diphthong -'''ui''' in the first syllable and that end in a vowel, also lengthen this vowel before adding the ending: ::<small>{{Tengwar|9lU5$}}</small> '''huinë''' "gloom" → <small>{{Tengwar|9lU5~VyE}}</small> '''huinéva'''
::<small>{{Tengwar|1lUt#}}</small> '''tuima''' "sprout" → <small>{{Tengwar|1lUt~CyE}}</small> '''tuimáva''' (but e.g. <small>{{Tengwar|zGs#}}</small> '''quinga''' "bow" doesn't contain the diphthong <small>{{Tengwar|lU}}</small> '''ui''' because <small>{{Tengwar|z}}</small> '''qu''' stands for '''cw''').
Words that have a stem-form in a vowel ([[../I-stems/]] and [[../U-stems/]]) use this stem-form: ::<small>{{Tengwar|aU7Y}}</small> '''curo''' "device" → <small>{{Tengwar|aU7UyE}}</small> '''curuva'''
::<small>{{Tengwar|j~Nt$}}</small> '''lómë''' "night" → <small>{{Tengwar|j~Nt%yE}}</small> '''lómiva'''
Words that have a stem-form in a consonant use their basic form and not the stem-form: ::<small>{{Tengwar|eT`N5}}</small> '''fion''' "hawk" → <small>{{Tengwar|eT`N5nE}}</small> '''fionwa''' (stem-form <small>{{Tengwar|eT`N2\}}</small> ''fiond-'')
::<small>{{Tengwar|1T7T`N8}}</small> '''tirios''' "burg" → <small>{{Tengwar|1T7T`N8nE}}</small> '''tirioswa''' (stem-form <small>{{Tengwar|1T7T`N81\}}</small> ''tiriost-'')
::<small>{{Tengwar|`Ct%j}}</small> '''amil''' "mother" → <small>{{Tengwar|`Ct%jnE}}</small> '''amilwa''' (stem-form <small>{{Tengwar|`Ct%j°\}}</small> ''amill-'')
::<small>{{Tengwar|1Y7Y5}}</small> '''toron''' "brother" → <small>{{Tengwar|1Y7Y5nE}}</small> '''toronwa''' (stem-form <small>{{Tengwar|1Y65\}}</small> ''torn-'')
::<small>{{Tengwar|iRj$6}}</small> '''seler''' "sister" → <small>{{Tengwar|iRj$6nE}}</small> '''selerwa''' (stem-form <small>{{Tengwar|iRj°\}}</small> ''sell-'')
::<small>{{Tengwar|9R5$1}}</small> '''henet''' "window" → <small>{{Tengwar|9R5$1nE}}</small> '''henetwa''' (stem-form <small>{{Tengwar|9R5$1+\}}</small> ''henets-'')
::<small>{{Tengwar|1Ej#5}}</small> '''talan''' "floor" → <small>{{Tengwar|1Ej#5nE}}</small> '''talanwa''' (stem-form <small>{{Tengwar|1Ej#t\}}</small> ''talam-'')
Exceptions: * words with a stem-form on -'''ss''': ::<small>{{Tengwar|5~B8}}</small> '''nís''' "woman" → <small>{{Tengwar|5%,RyE}}</small> '''nisseva''' (stem-form <small>{{Tengwar|5%,\}}</small> ''niss-'')
::<small>{{Tengwar|j%8}}</small> '''lis''' "honey" → <small>{{Tengwar|j%,RyE}}</small> '''lisseva''' (stem-form<small>{{Tengwar|j%,\}}</small> ''liss-'') * words with a stem-form on -'''c''': ::<small>{{Tengwar|eTj%1}}</small> '''filit''' "little bird" → <small>{{Tengwar|eTj%zD}}</small> '''filiqua''' (stem-form <small>{{Tengwar|eTj%a\}}</small> ''filic-'')
::<small>{{Tengwar|5$j$1}}</small> '''nelet''' "tooth" → <small>{{Tengwar|5$j$zD}}</small> '''nelequa''' (stem-form <small>{{Tengwar|5$ja\}}</small> ''nelc-'')
::<small>{{Tengwar|zR,R1}}</small> '''quesset''' "pillow" → <small>{{Tengwar|zR,RzD}}</small> '''quessequa''' (stem-form <small>{{Tengwar|zR,Ra\}}</small> ''quessec-'') * words with a long vowel that is shortened in the stem-form: ::<small>{{Tengwar|1~Cj}}</small> '''tál''' "foot" → <small>{{Tengwar|1EjnE}}</small> '''talwa''' (stem-form <small>{{Tengwar|1Ej\}}</small> ''tal-'')
::<small>{{Tengwar|5~V6}}</small> '''nér''' "man" → <small>{{Tengwar|5$6nE}}</small> '''nerwa''' (stem-form <small>{{Tengwar|5$6\}}</small> ''ner-'')
===Plural=== The ending is <small>{{Tengwar|\`ByE}}</small> -'''iva''': ::<small>{{Tengwar|t#aGj}}</small> '''macil''' "sword" → <small>{{Tengwar|t#aGj%yE}}</small> '''maciliva'''
::<small>{{Tengwar|`Vm#}}</small> '''elda''' "elf" → <small>{{Tengwar|`VmlDyE}}</small> '''eldaiva''' (note: this ending forms a diphthong when the noun ends in -'''a''', -'''o''' or -'''u''')
Exceptions: * words ending in <small>{{Tengwar|`V}}</small> -'''ë''' drop this <small>{{Tengwar|`V}}</small> -'''ë''' and have <small>{{Tengwar|~ByE}}</small> -'''íva''' as ending: :<small>{{Tengwar|j#,R}}</small> '''lassë''' "leaf" → <small>{{Tengwar|j#,~ByE}}</small> '''lassíva''' * words ending in <small>{{Tengwar|`B`V}}</small> -'''ië''' drop this <small>{{Tengwar|`B`V}}</small> -'''ië''' and have <small>{{Tengwar|~ByE}}</small> -'''íva''' as ending: :<small>{{Tengwar|t^65%`V}}</small> '''mornië''' "darkness" → <small>{{Tengwar|t^65~ByE}}</small> '''morníva''' * words ending in <small>{{Tengwar|`B}}</small> -'''i''' (or with a stem-form in <small>{{Tengwar|`B}}</small> -'''i''') also get <small>{{Tengwar|~ByE}}</small> -'''íva'''. Any preceding long vowel is shortened: ::<small>{{Tengwar|1~C7T}}</small> '''tári''' "queen" → <small>{{Tengwar|1E7~ByE}}</small> '''taríva'''
::<small>{{Tengwar|j~Nt$}}</small> '''lómë''' "night" → <small>{{Tengwar|j^t~ByE}}</small> '''lomíva'''
===Dual=== The dual is regular: u-duals get <small>{{Tengwar|\yE}}</small> -'''va''', t-duals get <small>{{Tengwar|\nE}}</small> -'''wa''': ::<small>{{Tengwar|aG7ÎD1}}</small> '''ciryat''' "a pair of ships" → <small>{{Tengwar|aG7ÎD1nE}}</small> '''ciryatwa''' (nom.sing.: <small>{{Tengwar|aG7ÎD}}</small> cirya)
::<small>{{Tengwar|`Cm&}}</small> '''aldu''' "a pair of trees" → <small>{{Tengwar|`Cm&yE}}</small> '''alduva''' (nom.sing.: <small>{{Tengwar|`Cm#}}</small> alda)
===Partitive Plural=== When the nominative partitive plural ends in <small>{{Tengwar|\j°%}}</small> -'''lli''', the possessive ends in <small>{{Tengwar|\j°%yE}}</small> -'''lliva''': ::<small>{{Tengwar|1Y7Y5}}</small> '''toron''' "brother" → <small>{{Tengwar|1Y7Yj°%}}</small> '''torolli''' → <small>{{Tengwar|1Y7Yj°%yE}}</small> '''torolliva'''
::<small>{{Tengwar|t#aGj}}</small> '''macil''' "sword" → <small>{{Tengwar|t#aGj°%}}</small> '''macilli''' → <small>{{Tengwar|t#aGj°%yE}}</small> '''macilliva'''
When the nominative partitive plural only has a single '''l''' before the final '''i''' then the possessive ends in -'''líva''': ::<small>{{Tengwar|aG7ÎD}}</small> '''cirya''' "ship" → <small>{{Tengwar|aG7ÎDj%}}</small> '''ciryali''' → <small>{{Tengwar|aG7ÎDj~ByE}}</small> '''ciryalíva'''
::<small>{{Tengwar|iD7E1}}</small> '''sarat''' "sign" → <small>{{Tengwar|iD7E1Rj%}}</small> '''sarateli''' → <small>{{Tengwar|iD7E1Rj~ByE}}</small> '''saratelíva'''
----
>> [[Neo-Quenya]] >> [[../Nouns/]] >> [[../Possessive/]]
{{BookCat}}

==Usage==
The dative is used for the indirect object. ::<small>{{Tengwar|`B 5~V6 `C4# `B qE6t# `B `Vm#5}}</small> '''i nér anta i parma <u>i eldan</u>''' "the man gives the book to the elf"
The word order is free because we can always recognize the indirect object by its ending: ::<small>{{Tengwar|`B 5~V6 `C4# `B qE6t# `B `Vm#5}}</small> '''i nér anta <u>i eldan</u> i parma''' "the man gives the elf the book" ::<small>{{Tengwar|`B `Vm#5 `B 5~V6 `C4# `B qE6t#}}</small> '''<u>i eldan</u> i nér anta i parma''' "to the elf the man gives the book" ::<small>{{Tengwar|`B 5~V6 `B `Vm#5 `C4# `B qE6t#}}</small> '''i nér <u>i eldan</u> anta i parma''' "the man, to the elf, gives the book"
Some verbs can have an indirect object without a direct object: ::<small>{{Tengwar|`B yR2% j%j1E6 `B `C7E5$5}}</small> '''i vendi liltar <u>i aranen</u>''' "the girls dance for the king"
The verb <small>{{Tengwar|`CqiR5\}}</small> '''apsen'''- "remit, forgive" has a direct object in the dative: ::<small>{{Tengwar|`B `C7E5 `CqiR5$ `B 5$7R5}}</small> '''i aran apsenë <u>i neren</u>''' "the king forgives the man"
The preposition <small>{{Tengwar|7~C}}</small> '''rá''' "on behalf of, for" is used with the dative: ::<small>{{Tengwar|`B `N6aY 1Uj°$ 7~C 8.D7Y2$5}}</small> '''i orco tullë rá <u>Sauronden</u>''' "the orc came on behalf of Sauron"
===Impersonal verbs===
The dative is also used for the recipient of certain impersonal verbs: ::<small>{{Tengwar|`B iRm^5 ~Nj# lDnT`N5}}</small> '''<u>i seldon</u> óla aiwion''' "the boy dreams about birds"
(see also: [[../Special Verbs/]])
==Formation== We discuss each of the numbers separately:
===Singular=== The basic ending is <small>{{Tengwar|\5}}</small> -'''n''' after vowels and <small>{{Tengwar|\`V5}}</small> -'''en''' after consonants.
Most words simply add this ending: ::<small>{{Tengwar|`C7E5}}</small> '''aran''' "king" → <small>{{Tengwar|`C7E5$5}}</small> '''aranen''' ::<small>{{Tengwar|1~C7T}}</small> '''tári''' "queen" → <small>{{Tengwar|1~C7T5}}</small> '''tárin''' ::<small>{{Tengwar|yR2$}}</small> '''vendë''' "girl" → <small>{{Tengwar|yR2$5}}</small> '''venden'''
Words that have a stem-form use this stem-form: ::<small>{{Tengwar|5~B8}}</small> '''nís''' "woman" → <small>{{Tengwar|5%,R5}}</small> '''nissen''' (stem-form <small>{{Tengwar|5%,\}}</small> ''niss-'') ::<small>{{Tengwar|aU7Y}}</small> '''curo''' "device" → <small>{{Tengwar|aU7U5}}</small> '''curun''' (stem-form <small>{{Tengwar|aU7U\}}</small> ''curu-'') ::<small>{{Tengwar|j~N5$}}</small> '''lómë''' "night" → <small>{{Tengwar|j~Nt%5}}</small> '''lómin''' (stem-form <small>{{Tengwar|j~Nt%\}}</small> ''lómi-'')
===Plural=== The ending is <small>{{Tengwar|\`B5}}</small> -'''in''': ::<small>{{Tengwar|t#aGj}}</small> '''macil''' "sword" → <small>{{Tengwar|t#aGj%5}}</small> '''macilin''' ::<small>{{Tengwar|`Vm#}}</small> '''elda''' "elf" → <small>{{Tengwar|`VmlD5}}</small> '''eldain''' (note: this ending forms a diphthong when the noun ends in <small>{{Tengwar|\`C}}</small> -'''a''', <small>{{Tengwar|\`N}}</small> -'''o''' or <small>{{Tengwar|\`M}}</small> -'''u''')
Exceptions: * words ending in <small>{{Tengwar|\`V}}</small> -'''ë''' drop this -'''ë''' and have <small>{{Tengwar|~B5}}</small> -'''ín''' as ending: ::<small>{{Tengwar|j#,R}}</small> '''lassë''' "leaf" → <small>{{Tengwar|j#,~B5}}</small> '''lassín''' * words ending in <small>{{Tengwar|\`B`V}}</small> -'''ië''' drop this -'''ië''' and have <small>{{Tengwar|\~B5}}</small> -'''ín''' as ending: ::<small>{{Tengwar|t^65%`V}}</small> '''mornië''' "darkness" → <small>{{Tengwar|t^65~B5}}</small> '''mornín''' * words ending in <small>{{Tengwar|\`B}}</small> -'''i''' (or with a stem-form in -'''i''') also get <small>{{Tengwar|\~B5}}</small> -'''ín''': ::<small>{{Tengwar|1~C7T}}</small> '''tári''' "queen" → <small>{{Tengwar|1~C7T5}}</small> '''tárín''' ::<small>{{Tengwar|j~Nt$}}</small> '''lómë''' "night" → <small>{{Tengwar|j~Nt~B5}}</small> '''lómín'''
===Dual=== The dual is regular: * u-duals get <small>{{Tengwar|\5}}</small> -'''n''': ::<small>{{Tengwar|`Cm&}}</small> '''aldu''' "a pair of trees" → <small>{{Tengwar|`Cm&5}}</small> '''aldun''' (nom.sing.: <small>{{Tengwar|`Cm#}}</small> alda) * in t-duals the final <small>{{Tengwar|\1}}</small> -'''t''' is replaced by <small>{{Tengwar|\4}}</small> -'''nt''': ::<small>{{Tengwar|aG7ÎE1}}</small> '''ciryat''' "a pair of ships" → <small>{{Tengwar|aG7ÎE4}}</small> '''ciryant''' (nom.sing.: <small>{{Tengwar|aG7ÎE}}</small> cirya) ::<small>{{Tengwar|`C7E5$1}}</small> '''aranet''' "a pair of kings" → <small>{{Tengwar|`C7E5$4}}</small> '''aranent''' (nom.sing.: <small>{{Tengwar|`C7E5}}</small> aran) (note: these words are the only Neo-Quenya words that end in more than one consonant)
===Partitive Plural===
We always add -'''n''' to the nominative partitive plural: ::<small>{{Tengwar|aG7ÎEj%}}</small> '''ciryali''' "some ships" → <small>{{Tengwar|aG7ÎEj%5}}</small> '''ciryalin''' (nom.sing.: <small>{{Tengwar|aG7ÎE}}</small> cirya)
----
>> [[Neo-Quenya]] >> [[../Nouns/]] >> [[../Dative/]]
{{BookCat}}

revision.comment: Inclusion of Quenya mode Tengwar alongside Quenya written in the Latin alphabet. Revision to word formation and exceptions. Replaced "toron" with "haran", as toron is outdated by háno (stem form khan-)
revision.text:
==Usage==
The ablative corresponds to the preposition "from".
So it is used for origins that involve motion:
::<small>{{Tengwar|1Uj&yE5 aG7ÎEj°^}}</small> '''tuluvan <u>i ciryallo</u>''' "I shall come from the boat"
or for the originator of something given:
::<small>{{Tengwar|1UyU5$8 `B t#j1E `B aY2&j°^}}</small> '''tuvunes i malta <u>i cundullo</u>''' "he received the gold from the prince"
The ablative is also used with following words: :the verb <small>{{Tengwar|7Ua\}}</small> '''ruc'''- "fear", to express what is "feared":
::<small>{{Tengwar|`B 9~B5# 7Uf$ `B 9lU5$j°^}}</small> '''i hína runcë <u>i huinello</u>''' "the child feared the shadow"
:the preposition <small>{{Tengwar|`V1}}</small> '''et''' "out, out of":
::<small>{{Tengwar|`B eR`C 1Uj°$ `V1 `B `NjqRj°^}}</small> '''i fëa tullë et <u>i olpello</u>''' "the spirit came out of the bottle"
==Formation==
===Singular===
The basic ending is <small>{{Tengwar|\j°^}}</small> -'''llo''' after vowels and <small>{{Tengwar|\`Vj°^}}</small> -'''ello''' after consonants.
Most words simply add this ending: ::<small>{{Tengwar|j#,R}}</small> '''lassë''' "leaf" → <small>{{Tengwar|j#,Rj°^}}</small> '''lassello'''
::<small>{{Tengwar|1~C7T}}</small> '''tári''' "queen" → <small>{{Tengwar|1~C7Tj°^}}</small> '''tárillo'''
::<small>{{Tengwar|yR2$}}</small> '''vendë''' "girl" → <small>{{Tengwar|yR2$j°^}}</small> '''vendello'''
::<small>{{Tengwar|`C7E5}}</small> '''aran''' "king" → <small>{{Tengwar|`C7E5$j°^}}</small> '''aranello'''
::<small>{{Tengwar|`C1E6}}</small> '''atar''' "father" → <small>{{Tengwar|`C1E7Rj°^}}</small> '''atarello'''
::<small>{{Tengwar|iD7E1}}</small> '''sarat''' "sign" → <small>{{Tengwar|iD7E1Rj°^}}</small> '''saratello'''
Words that have a stem-form use this stem-form: ::<small>{{Tengwar|5~B8}}</small> '''nís''' "woman" → <small>{{Tengwar|5%,Rj°^}}</small> '''nissello'''
::<small>{{Tengwar|aU7Y}}</small> '''curo''' "device" → <small>{{Tengwar|aU7Uj°^}}</small> '''curullo'''
::<small>{{Tengwar|j~Nt$}}</small> '''lómë''' "night" → <small>{{Tengwar|j~Nt%j°^}}</small> '''lómillo'''
Exceptions: * words ending in <small>{{Tengwar|\j}}</small> -'''l''' contract with the ending: ::<small>{{Tengwar|t$5$j}}</small> '''menel''' "heaven" → <small>{{Tengwar|t$5$j°^}}</small> '''menello'''
* providing no duplicate words arise, endings in <small>{{Tengwar|\6}}</small> -'''r''', <small>{{Tengwar|\5}}</small> -'''n''', <small>{{Tengwar|\8}}</small> -'''s''' lose this final consonant before adding <small>{{Tengwar|\j°^}}</small> -'''llo''': ::<small>{{Tengwar|7~Nt$5}}</small> '''rómen''' "east" → <small>{{Tengwar|7~Nt$j°^}}</small> '''rómello'''
::<small>{{Tengwar|1EyE8}}</small> '''tavas''' "woodland" → <small>{{Tengwar|1EyEj°^}}</small> '''tavallo'''
When using these rules you have to look at the final letter of the stem-form (and not at the final letter of the nominative): ::<small>{{Tengwar|1Ej#5}}</small> '''talan''' "floor" → <small>{{Tengwar|1Ej#t$j°^}}</small> '''talamello''' (stem-form <small>{{Tengwar|1Ej#t\}}</small> ''talam-'')
::<small>{{Tengwar|5~V5}}</small> '''nén''' "water" → <small>{{Tengwar|5$j°^}}</small> '''nello''' (stem-form <small>{{Tengwar|5$5\}}</small> ''nen-'')
The ablative of contracted stems (see [[../Stem-forms/]]) doesn't use the stem-form but the nominative singular: ::<small>{{Tengwar|9C7E5}}</small> '''haran''' "leader" → <small>{{Tengwar|9C7Ej°^}}</small> '''harallo''' (stem-form <small>{{Tengwar|9C65}}</small> ''harn-'')
Doubled L-stems also use the nominative singular: ::<small>{{Tengwar|`Ct%j}}</small> '''amil''' "mother" → <small>{{Tengwar|`Ct%j°^}}</small> '''amillo''' (stem-form <small>{{Tengwar|`Ct%j°\}}</small> ''amill-'')
(so for these nouns the genitive and ablative singular are identical).
===Plural===
The ending is <small>{{Tengwar|\j°^5}}</small> -'''llon''' after vowels and <small>{{Tengwar|\`Bj°^5}}</small> -'''illon''' after consonants. ::<small>{{Tengwar|t%2^5}}</small> '''mindon''' "tower" → <small>{{Tengwar|t%2^5%j°^5}}</small> '''mindonillon'''
::<small>{{Tengwar|`Vm#}}</small> '''elda''' "elf" → <small>{{Tengwar|`Vm#j°^5}}</small> '''eldallon'''
(note: sometimes the plural endings <small>{{Tengwar|\j°^6}}</small> -'''llor''' and <small>{{Tengwar|\`Bj°^6}}</small> -'''illor''' are seen, but these are not preferred. They may have something to with nouns having an -r plural form).
Exceptions: * words ending in <small>{{Tengwar|\j}}</small> -'''l''' contract with the ending:
::<small>{{Tengwar|t#aGj}}</small> '''macil''' "sword" → <small>{{Tengwar|t#aGj°^5}}</small> '''macillon'''
* doubled L-stems use the nominative singular:
::<small>{{Tengwar|`Ct%j}}</small> '''amil''' "mother" → <small>{{Tengwar|`Ct%j°^5}}</small> '''amillon''' (stem-form ''amill-'')
===Dual===
* u-duals get <small>{{Tengwar|\j°^}}</small> -'''llo''' onto the nominative dual plural of the noun:
::<small>{{Tengwar|`Cm&}}</small> '''aldu''' "a pair of trees" → <small>{{Tengwar|`Cm&j°^}}</small> '''aldullo''' (nom.sing.: <small>{{Tengwar|`Cm#}}</small> alda)
* in t-duals the final <small>{{Tengwar|\1}}</small> -'''t''' is replaced by <small>{{Tengwar|\j1Y}}</small> -'''lto''':
::<small>{{Tengwar|aG7ÎE1}}</small> '''ciryat''' "a pair of ships" → <small>{{Tengwar|aG7ÎEj1Y}}</small> '''ciryalto''' (nom.sing.: <small>{{Tengwar|aG7ÎE}}</small> cirya)
::<small>{{Tengwar|`C7E5$1}}</small> '''aranet''' "a pair of kings" → <small>{{Tengwar|`C7E5$j1Y}}</small> '''aranelto''' (nom.sing.: <small>{{Tengwar|`C7E5}}</small> aran)
===Partitive Plural===
We add <small>{{Tengwar|\j°^5}}</small> -'''llon''' or <small>{{Tengwar|\j°^}}</small> -'''llo''' to the nominative partitive plural of the noun: ::<small>{{Tengwar|aG7ÎEj%}}</small> '''ciryali''' "some ships" → <small>{{Tengwar|aG7ÎEj%j°^5 - aGÎEj%j°^}}</small> '''ciryalillon'''/'''ciryalillo''' (nom.sing.: <small>{{Tengwar|aG7ÎE}}</small> cirya) (but the ending <small>{{Tengwar|\j°^5}}</small> -'''llon''' is preferred, and again sometimes <small>{{Tengwar|\j°^6}}</small> -'''llor''' is seen)
----
>> [[Neo-Quenya]] >> [[../Nouns/]] >> [[../Ablative/]]
{{BookCat}}

revision.comment: Inclusion of Quenya mode Tengwar alongside Quenya written in the Latin alphabet. Some minor word changes
revision.text:
==Usage==
The allative corresponds to the preposition "towards" (and this is frequently abbreviated to "to").
So it is used for destinations: ::<small>{{Tengwar|j$j´&yE5 `B aG7ÎE5:#}}</small> '''lelyuvan <u>i ciryanna</u>''' "I shall go to(wards) the boat"
or for a direction in which the action is performed: ::<small>{{Tengwar|zF4$8 `Vj$2%j$5:#}}</small> '''quentes <u>Elendilenna</u>''' "he spoke to(wards) Elendil"
::<small>{{Tengwar|j$2$5 `N81Y5:#}}</small> '''lenden <u>ostonna</u>''' "I went to town"
The preposition "into" is translated by <small>{{Tengwar|t%6}}</small> '''mir''' followed by a nominative: ::<small>{{Tengwar|j$2$5 t%6 `N81Y}}</small> '''lenden <u>mir osto</u>''' "I went into town"
The allative is also used with following verbs: :<small>{{Tengwar|alD1E\}}</small> '''caita'''- "lie", to express whereupon the subject "lies":
::<small>{{Tengwar|`B aG7ÎE alD1E `B eDjt#5:#6}}</small> '''i cirya caita <u>i falmannar</u>''' "the ship lies upon the waves"
:<small>{{Tengwar|1Uj´#\}}</small> '''tulya'''- "lead", to express whereinto the subject "is lead":
::<small>{{Tengwar|1Uj´#5 `B 5~V6 `B 1.D7R5:#}}</small> '''tulyan i nér <u>i taurenna</u>''' "I lead the man into the forest"
==Formation==
We discuss each of the numbers separately:
===Singular===
The basic ending is <small>{{Tengwar|\5:#}}</small> -'''nna''' after vowels and <small>{{Tengwar|\`V5:#}}</small> -'''enna''' after consonants.
Most words simply add this ending: ::<small>{{Tengwar|`C7E5}}</small> '''aran''' "king" → <small>{{Tengwar|`C7E5$5:#}}</small> '''aranenna'''
::<small>{{Tengwar|1~C7T}}</small> '''tári''' "queen" → <small>{{Tengwar|1~C7T5:#}}</small> '''tárinna'''
::<small>{{Tengwar|yR2$}}</small> '''vendë''' "girl" → <small>{{Tengwar|yR2$5:#}}</small> '''vendenna'''
::<small>{{Tengwar|9~C5^}}</small> '''háno''' "brother" → <small>{{Tengwar|9~C5^5:#}}</small> '''hánonna'''
Words that have a stem-form use this stem-form: ::<small>{{Tengwar|5~B8}}</small> '''nís''' "woman" → <small>{{Tengwar|5%,R5:#}}</small> '''nissenna'''
::<small>{{Tengwar|aU7Y}}</small> '''curo''' "device" → <small>{{Tengwar|aU7U5:#}}</small> '''curunna'''
::<small>{{Tengwar|j~N5$}}</small> '''lómë''' "night" → <small>{{Tengwar|j~Nt%5:#}}</small> '''lóminna'''
Exceptions: :words ending in <small>{{Tengwar|\5}}</small> -'''n''' contract with the ending:
::<small>{{Tengwar|t%2^5}}</small> '''mindon''' "tower" → <small>{{Tengwar|t%2^5:#}}</small> '''mindonna'''
:words ending in <small>{{Tengwar|\j}}</small> -'''l''' change <small>{{Tengwar|j}}</small> '''l''' + <small>{{Tengwar|5:#}}</small> '''nna''' into <small>{{Tengwar|\m#}}</small> -'''lda''':
::<small>{{Tengwar|t$5$j}}</small> '''menel''' "heaven" → <small>{{Tengwar|t$5$m#}}</small> '''menelda'''
When using these rules you have to look at the final letter of the stem-form (and not at the final letter of the nominative): ::<small>{{Tengwar|1Ej#5}}</small> '''talan''' "floor" → <small>{{Tengwar|1Ej#t$5:#}}</small> '''talamenna''' (stem-form <small>{{Tengwar|1Ej#t\}}</small> ''talam-'')
::<small>{{Tengwar|5~V5}}</small> '''nén''' "water" → <small>{{Tengwar|5$5:#}}</small> '''nenna''' (stem-form <small>{{Tengwar|5$5\}}</small> ''nen-'')
The allative of contracted stems (see [[../Stem-forms/]]) doesn't use the stem-form but the nominative singular: ::<small>{{Tengwar|9C7E5}}</small> '''haran''' "leader" → <small>{{Tengwar|9C7E5:#}}</small> '''haranna''' (stem-form <small>{{Tengwar|9C65\}}</small> ''harn-'')
Doubled N-stems also use the nominative singular: ::<small>{{Tengwar|`NjnR5}}</small> '''olwen''' "branch" → <small>{{Tengwar|`NjnR5:#}}</small> '''olwenna''' (stem-form <small>{{Tengwar|`NjnR5:\}}</small> ''olwenn-'')
===Plural===
The ending is <small>{{Tengwar|\5:#6}}</small> -'''nnar''' after vowels and <small>{{Tengwar|\`B5:#6}}</small> -'''innar''' after consonants. ::<small>{{Tengwar|t#aGj}}</small> '''macil''' "sword" → <small>{{Tengwar|t#aGj%5:#6}}</small> '''macilinnar'''
::<small>{{Tengwar|`Vm#}}</small> '''elda''' "elf" → <small>{{Tengwar|`Nm#5:#6}}</small> '''eldannar'''
Exception: :words ending in <small>{{Tengwar|\5}}</small> -'''n''' contract with the ending:
::<small>{{Tengwar|t%2^5}}</small> '''mindon''' "tower" → <small>{{Tengwar|t%2^5:#6}}</small> '''mindonnar'''
:doubled N-stems use the nominative singular:
::<small>{{Tengwar|`NjnR5}}</small> '''olwen''' "branch" → <small>{{Tengwar|`NjnR5:#6}}</small> '''olwennar''' (stem-form <small>{{Tengwar|`NjnR5:\}}</small> ''olwenn-'')
===Dual===
:u-duals get <small>{{Tengwar|\5:#}}</small> -'''nna''':
::<small>{{Tengwar|`Cm&}}</small> '''aldu''' "a pair of trees" → <small>{{Tengwar|`Cm&5:#}}</small> '''aldunna''' (nom.sing.: <small>{{Tengwar|`Cm#}}</small> alda)
:in t-duals the final <small>{{Tengwar|\1}}</small> -'''t''' is replaced by <small>{{Tengwar|\4#}}</small> -'''nta''':
::<small>{{Tengwar|aG7ÎE1}}</small> '''ciryat''' "a pair of ships" → <small>{{Tengwar|aG7ÎE4#}}</small> '''ciryanta''' (nom.sing.: <small>{{Tengwar|aG7ÎE}}</small> cirya)
::<small>{{Tengwar|`C7E5$1}}</small> '''aranet''' "a pair of kings" → <small>{{Tengwar|`C7E5$4#}}</small> '''aranenta''' (nom.sing.: <small>{{Tengwar|`C7E5}}</small> aran)
===Partitive Plural===
We add <small>{{Tengwar|\5:#6}}</small> -'''nnar''' or <small>{{Tengwar|\5:#}}</small> -'''nna''' to the nominative partitive plural: ::<small>{{Tengwar|aG7ÎEj%}}</small> '''ciryali''' "some ships" → <small>{{Tengwar|aG7ÎEj%5:#6 - aG7ÎEj%5:#}}</small> '''ciryalinnar'''/'''ciryalinna''' (nom.sing.: <small>{{Tengwar|aG7ÎE}}</small> cirya)
::<small>{{Tengwar|eDjt#j%}}</small> '''falmali''' "some (crested or foaming) waves" → <small>{{Tengwar|eDjt#j%5:#6}}</small> '''falmalinnar''' (nom.sing.: <small>{{Tengwar|eDjt#}}</small> falma) (but the ending <small>{{Tengwar|\5:#6}}</small> -'''nnar''' is preferred)
----
>> [[Neo-Quenya]] >> [[../Nouns/]] >> [[../Allative/]]
{{BookCat}}

== [[:Image:BlendoPoses2.jpg]] == You cannot mark "noncommercial" image as GFDL. GFDL allows all uses, including commercial. You also write that it's "freely distributable" - this may mean that modification of this image is not allowed. All GFDL work may be altered freely. I'm sorry, but Wikibooks cannot accept such images. According to new rules, every "noncommercial" images have to be deleted. If it is possible to change license of these images, please do it. --[[User:Derbeth|Derbeth]] [[User talk:Derbeth|talk]] 22:47, 27 November 2005 (UTC) : Now everything is ok - the only problem was "noncommercial" condition in description of this image. CC-BY-SA 2.5 is license accepted by Wikibooks. --[[User:Derbeth|Derbeth]] [[User talk:Derbeth|talk]] 08:58, 19 December 2005 (UTC) == Your account will be renamed ==
Hello, The developer team at Wikimedia is making some changes to how accounts work, as part of our on-going efforts to provide new and better tools for our users like cross-wiki notifications. These changes will mean you have the same account name everywhere. This will let us give you new features that will help you edit and discuss better, and allow more flexible user permissions for tools. One of the side-effects of this is that user accounts will now have to be unique across all 900 Wikimedia wikis. See [[m:Special:MyLanguage/Single User Login finalisation announcement|the announcement]] for more information. Unfortunately, your account clashes with another account also called Fiddle. To make sure that both of you can use all Wikimedia projects in future, we have reserved the name Fiddle~enwikibooks that only you will have. If you like it, you don't have to do anything. If you do not like it, you can [[Special:GlobalRenameRequest|pick out a different name]]. Your account will still work as before, and you will be credited for all your edits made so far, but you will have to use the new account name when you log in. Sorry for the inconvenience. Yours,
[[m:User:Keegan (WMF)|Keegan Peterzell]]
Community Liaison, Wikimedia Foundation
