revision.comment: Inclusion of Quenya mode Tengwar alongside Quenya written in the Latin alphabet. More examples added, removed and corrected.
revision.text:
==Usage==
The locative corresponds to the prepositions "in", "on" and "upon".
It is always used for places: ::<small>{{Tengwar|`V`C5 aY`C,R}}</small> '''ëan <u>coassë</u>''' "I am in a house"
::<small>{{Tengwar|`B aG7ÎEt^ `V`C `B aG7ÎE,R}}</small> '''i ciryamo ëa <u>i ciryassë</u>''' "the sailor is on the ship"
::<small>{{Tengwar|`B lDnG 9~Ct# `NjnE,R}}</small> '''i aiwi háma <u>olwassë</u>''' "the bird sits upon a branch"
or for a moment or period in time when something happens: ::<small>{{Tengwar|`M1~Mj%`V5 `B j~Nt%,R}}</small> '''utúlien <u>i lómissë</u>''' "I have come in the night"
There are two situations in which we don't use the locative: :The preposition "into" is translated by <small>{{Tengwar|t%6}}</small> '''mir''' followed by a nominative:
::<small>{{Tengwar|5~V6 yE4#5$ t%6 `B t#j°$}}</small> '''nér vantanë <u>mir i mallë</u>''' "a man walked into the street"
:The preposition "in" can also be used to denote a condition or feeling someone has, in that case we use the preposition <small>{{Tengwar|t%}}</small> '''mi''' (or <small>{{Tengwar|t~B}}</small> '''mí''', this is short for <small>{{Tengwar|t%}}</small> '''mi''' + <small>{{Tengwar|`B}}</small> '''i'''):
::<small>{{Tengwar|5~V6 yE4#5$ t% t^65%`V}}</small> '''nér vantanë <u>mi mornië</u>''' "a man walked in darkness"
::<small>{{Tengwar|5~V6 yE4#5$ t~B 7Ts#}}</small> '''nér vantanë <u>mí ringa</u>''' "a man walked in the cold"
==Formation==
We discuss each of the numbers separately:
===Singular===
The basic ending is <small>{{Tengwar|\,R}}</small> -'''ssë''' after vowels and <small>{{Tengwar|\`V,R}}</small> -'''essë''' after consonants.
Most words simply add this ending: ::<small>{{Tengwar|`C7E5}}</small> '''aran''' "king" → <small>{{Tengwar|`C7E5$,R}}</small> '''aranessë'''
::<small>{{Tengwar|1~C7T}}</small> '''tári''' "queen" → <small>{{Tengwar|1~C7T,R}}</small> '''tárissë'''
::<small>{{Tengwar|yR2$}}</small> '''vendë''' "girl" → <small>{{Tengwar|yR2$,R}}</small> '''vendessë'''
::<small>{{Tengwar|9~C5^}}</small> '''háno''' "brother" → <small>{{Tengwar|9~C5^,R}}</small> '''hánossë'''
Words that have a stem-form use this stem-form: ::<small>{{Tengwar|iD6}}</small> '''sar''' "pebble" → <small>{{Tengwar|iDuR,R}}</small> '''sardessë''' (stem-form <small>{{Tengwar|iDu\}}</small> ''sard-'')
::<small>{{Tengwar|aU7Y}}</small> '''curo''' "device" → <small>{{Tengwar|aU7U,R}}</small> '''curussë''' (stem-form <small>{{Tengwar|aU7U\}}</small> ''curu-'')
::<small>{{Tengwar|j~Nt$}}</small> '''lómë''' "night" → <small>{{Tengwar|j~Nt%,R}}</small> '''lómissë''' (stem-form <small>{{Tengwar|j~Nt%\}}</small> ''lómi-'')
Exceptions: :words ending in <small>{{Tengwar|\8}}</small> -'''s''' contract with the ending:
::<small>{{Tengwar|`C6zGj%8}}</small> '''arquilis''' "desert" → <small>{{Tengwar|`C6zGj%,R}}</small> '''arquilissë'''
:words ending in <small>{{Tengwar|\1}}</small> -'''t''' only get <small>{{Tengwar|iD}}</small> -'''së''' as ending to make <small>{{Tengwar|\1R+ - \1R¡ - \1RÇ}}</small> -'''tsë''':
::<small>{{Tengwar|`VaR1}}</small> '''ecet''' "short sword" → <small>{{Tengwar|`VaR1R+}}</small> '''ecetsë'''
:words ending in <small>{{Tengwar|\j}}</small> -'''l''' change <small>{{Tengwar|j}}</small> '''l''' + <small>{{Tengwar|,R}}</small> '''ssë''' into <nowiki>=</nowiki> <small>{{Tengwar|\m$}}</small> -'''ldë''':
::<small>{{Tengwar|t$5$j}}</small> '''menel''' "heaven" → <small>{{Tengwar|t$5$m$}}</small> '''meneldë'''
:words ending in <small>{{Tengwar|\5}}</small> -'''n''' change <small>{{Tengwar|5}}</small> '''n''' + <small>{{Tengwar|,R}}</small> '''ssë''' into <nowiki>=</nowiki> <small>{{Tengwar|\2$}}</small> -'''ndë''':
::<small>{{Tengwar|aF5$5}}</small> '''cemen''' "earth, soil" → <small>{{Tengwar|aFt$2$}}</small> '''cemendë'''
Words that in the nominative end on <small>{{Tengwar|\iR}}</small> -'''ssë''' don't have a locative case, when a locative would be needed they use the preposition <small>{{Tengwar|t%}}</small> '''mi''': ::<small>{{Tengwar|y~B7R,R}}</small> '''Víressë''' "April" → <small>{{Tengwar|t% y~B7R,R}}</small> '''mi Víressë'''
Stem-forms show quite a lot of exceptions in this case (see [[../Stem-forms/]]): :The locative of contracted stems doesn't use the stem-form but the nominative singular:
::<small>{{Tengwar|9C7E5}}</small> '''haran''' "leader" → <small>{{Tengwar|9C7E2$}}</small> '''harandë''' (stem-form <small>{{Tengwar|9C65\}}</small> ''harn-'')
:Doubled S-stems simply add <small>{{Tengwar|\`V}}</small> -'''ë''' to the stem-form:
::<small>{{Tengwar|eDj#8}}</small> '''falas''' "beach" → <small>{{Tengwar|eDj#,R}}</small> '''falassë''' (stem-form <small>{{Tengwar|eDj#8\}}</small> ''falas-'')
:T-stems that add -'''s''' also follow this rule:
::<small>{{Tengwar|9R5$1}}</small> '''henet''' "window" → <small>{{Tengwar|9R5$1R+}}</small> '''henetsë''' (stem-form <small>{{Tengwar|9R5$1+\}}</small> ''henets-'')
:C-stems are changed as follows:
::<small>{{Tengwar|zR,R1}}</small> '''quesset''' "pillow" → <small>{{Tengwar|zR,Ra<nowiki>|</nowiki>R}}</small> '''quessexë''' (stem-form <small>{{Tengwar|zR,Ra\}}</small> ''quessec-'')
:but '''nelet''' uses the rule of the T-stems in this case:
::<small>{{Tengwar|5$j$1}}</small> '''nelet''' "tooth" → <small>{{Tengwar|5$j$1R+}}</small> '''neletsë''' (stem-form <small>{{Tengwar|5$ja\}}</small> ''nelc-'')
:M-stems use the nominative instead of the stem-form:
::<small>{{Tengwar|1Ej#5}}</small> '''talan''' "floor" → <small>{{Tengwar|1Ej#2$}}</small> '''talandë''' (stem-form <small>{{Tengwar|1Ej#t\}}</small> ''talam-'')
===Plural===
The ending is <small>{{Tengwar|\,R5}}</small> -'''ssen''' after vowels and <small>{{Tengwar|\`B,R5}}</small> -'''issen''' after consonants. ::<small>{{Tengwar|t#aGj}}</small> '''macil''' "sword" → <small>{{Tengwar|t#aGj%,R5}}</small> '''macilissen''' ::<small>{{Tengwar|`Vm#}}</small> '''elda''' "elf" → <small>{{Tengwar|`Vm#,R5}}</small> '''eldassen'''
Exceptions: In the plural the different exceptions generally aren't used, only when a word would end on <small>{{Tengwar|\iG,R5}}</small> -'''sissen''' (or <small>{{Tengwar|\aG,R5}}</small> -'''cissen''') is the ending shortened: :words ending in <small>{{Tengwar|\8}}</small> -'''s''':
::<small>{{Tengwar|`C6zGj%8}}</small> '''arquilis''' "desert" → <small>{{Tengwar|`C6zGj%,R5}}</small> '''arquilissen'''
:Doubled S-stems:
::<small>{{Tengwar|eDj#8}}</small> '''falas''' "beach" → <small>{{Tengwar|eDj#,R5}}</small> '''falassen''' (stem-form <small>{{Tengwar|eDj#8\}}</small> ''falas-'')
:T-stems that add <small>{{Tengwar|\8}}</small> -'''s''':
::<small>{{Tengwar|9R5$1}}</small> '''henet''' "window" → <small>{{Tengwar|9R5$1RÅ5}}</small> '''henetsen''' (stem-form <small>{{Tengwar|9R5$1+\}}</small> ''henets-'')
:C-stems:
::<small>{{Tengwar|zR,R1}}</small> '''quesset''' "pillow" → <small>{{Tengwar|zR,Ra<nowiki>|</nowiki>R5}}</small> '''quessexen''' (stem-form <small>{{Tengwar|zR,Ra\}}</small> ''quessec-'')
::<small>{{Tengwar|5$j$1}}</small> '''nelet''' "tooth" → <small>{{Tengwar|5$j$1RÅ5}}</small> '''neletsen''' (stem-form <small>{{Tengwar|5$ja\}}</small> ''nelc-'')
===Dual===
:u-duals get <small>{{Tengwar|\,R}}</small> -'''ssë''':
::<small>{{Tengwar|`Cm&}}</small> '''aldu''' "a pair of trees" → <small>{{Tengwar|`Cm&,R}}</small> '''aldussë''' (nom.sing.: <small>{{Tengwar|`Cm#}}</small> alda)
:t-duals get <small>{{Tengwar|\iR}}</small> -'''së''':
::<small>{{Tengwar|aG7ÎE1}}</small> '''ciryat''' "a pair of ships" → <small>{{Tengwar|aG7ÎE1R+}}</small> '''ciryatsë''' (nom.sing.: <small>{{Tengwar|aG7ÎE}}</small>cirya)
::<small>{{Tengwar|`C7E5$1}}</small> '''aranet''' "a pair of kings" → <small>{{Tengwar|`C7E5$1R+}}</small> '''aranetsë''' (nom.sing.: <small>{{Tengwar|`C7E5}}</small> aran)
===Partitive Plural===
We add <small>{{Tengwar|\,R5}}</small> -'''ssen''' or <small>{{Tengwar|\,R}}</small> -'''ssë''' to the nominative partitive plural: ::<small>{{Tengwar|aG7ÎEj%}}</small> '''ciryali''' "some ships" → <small>{{Tengwar|aG7ÎEj%,R5 - aG7ÎEj%,R}}</small> '''ciryalissen'''/'''ciryalissë''' (nom.sing.: <small>{{Tengwar|aG7ÎE}}</small> cirya)
:(but the ending <small>{{Tengwar|\,R5}}</small> -'''ssen''' is preferred)
----
>> [[Neo-Quenya]] >> [[../Nouns/]] >> [[../Locative/]]
{{BookCat}}

revision.comment: Spacing for Tengwar and its revision.
revision.text:
==Usage==
The instrumental corresponds to the preposition "with": ::<small>{{Tengwar|1~VaD4$ 1RaGm$5}}</small> '''técantë <u>tecilden</u>''' "they are writing with a pen"
But not all uses of the preposition "with" correspond to an instrumental, only when the underlying meaning is "with the help of" or "by means of" this case is used.
For example the sentence: ::<small>{{Tengwar|aR5:$5Ì$1 `C8 `Vm#}}</small> '''cennenyet as elda''' "I saw them with an elf" In this sentence we mean that they were together with an elf, not that I was using an elf to see them better.
Sometimes the instrumental corresponds to the English preposition "through": ::<small>{{Tengwar|j#,G j#4#6 `B 8~M7T5$5}}</small> '''lassi lantar <u>i súrinen</u>''' "leaves fall through the wind"
In the passive voice (see [[../Syntaxis/]]) the instrumental is also used for the agent and in English the agent is expressed by the preposition "by".
Except for the instrumental the preposition "with" can be translated into Quenya in several ways: * ownership: <small>{{Tengwar|`C6nE <nowiki>=</nowiki> `C6nR}}</small> '''arwa'''/'''arwë''' with a [[../Genitive|genitive]]:
::<small>{{Tengwar|5.DaY `C6nE 9C6t^}}</small> '''nauco arwa harmo''' "a dwarf with a treasure"
* "together with": <small>{{Tengwar|`C8}}</small> '''as''' (used with a singular)/ <small>{{Tengwar|hÎY}}</small> '''yo''' (used with plural, dual):
::<small>{{Tengwar|t#1T5 `C8 `C1E7T5Ì#}}</small> '''matin as atarinya''' "I eat with my father"
::<small>{{Tengwar|t#1T5 hÎY 5%m^5Ì#6}}</small> '''matin yo nildonyar''' "I eat with my friends"
* also in this meaning the prefix <small>{{Tengwar|~N\}}</small> '''ó'''- is used with [[../Personal pronouns|personal pronouns]]:
::<small>{{Tengwar|j$2$5 ~NiR `B `N81Y5:#}}</small> '''lenden ósë i ostonna''' "I went with her to town"
:The complete list is:
::<small>{{Tengwar|~N5%}}</small> '''óni''' "with me"
::<small>{{Tengwar|~Nj$}}</small> '''ólë''' "with you"
::<small>{{Tengwar|~Nt$}}</small> '''ómë''' "with us"
::<small>{{Tengwar|~N1R}}</small> '''ótë''' "with them"
::<small>{{Tengwar|~N1E \ ~N1}}</small> '''óta'''/'''ót''' "with it"
::<small>{{Tengwar|~NiR \ ~NiD}}</small> '''ósë'''/'''ósa''' "with him/her / it"
==Formation== We discuss each of the numbers separately:
===Singular=== The basic ending is <small>{{Tengwar|\5$5}}</small> -'''nen'''. So after vowels this case is equal to the [[../Dative|dative]] with an extra <small>{{Tengwar|\`V5}}</small> -'''en''' ::<small>{{Tengwar|1~C7T}}</small> '''tári''' "queen" → <small>{{Tengwar|1~C7T5$5}}</small> '''tárinen'''
::<small>{{Tengwar|yR2$}}</small> '''vendë''' "girl" → <small>{{Tengwar|yR2$5$5}}</small> '''vendenen'''
When a noun ends on <small>{{Tengwar|\6}}</small> -'''r''' or <small>{{Tengwar|\5}}</small> -'''n''', we add <small>{{Tengwar|\5$5}}</small> -'''nen''': ::<small>{{Tengwar|`C1R6}}</small> '''atar''' "father" → <small>{{Tengwar|`C1E65$5}}</small> '''atarnen'''
::<small>{{Tengwar|`Vj$5}}</small> '''elen''' "star" → <small>{{Tengwar|`Vj$5:$5}}</small> '''elennen''' or has a stem-form on <small>{{Tengwar|\t}}</small> -'''m''', <small>{{Tengwar|\6}}</small> -'''r''' or <small>{{Tengwar|\5}}</small> -'''n''': ::<small>{{Tengwar|1Ej#5}}</small> '''talan''' "floor" → <small>{{Tengwar|1Ej#t5$5}}</small> '''talamnen''' (stem-form <small>{{Tengwar|1Ej#t\}}</small> ''talam-'')
::<small>{{Tengwar|`Nj^8}}</small> '''olos''' "dream" → <small>{{Tengwar|`Nj^65$5}}</small> '''olornen''' (stem-form <small>{{Tengwar|`Nj^6\}}</small> ''olor-'') The instrumental of contracted stems doesn't use the stem-form but the nominative singular: ::<small>{{Tengwar|1Y7Y5}}</small> '''toron''' "brother" → <small>{{Tengwar|1Y7Y5:$5}}</small> '''toronnen''' (stem-form ''torn-'')
When a noun or its stem-form ends on <small>{{Tengwar|\q}}</small> -'''p''', <small>{{Tengwar|\a}}</small> -'''c''' or <small>{{Tengwar|\1}}</small> -'''t''', we apply nasal inversion (see [[Quenya/Past Tense]]): ::<small>{{Tengwar|`VaR1}}</small> '''ecet''' "short sword" → <small>{{Tengwar|`VaR4$5}}</small> '''ecenten'''
::<small>{{Tengwar|eGj%1}}</small> '''filit''' "little bird" → <small>{{Tengwar|eGj%f$5}}</small> '''filincen''' (stem-form <small>{{Tengwar|eGj%a\}}</small> ''filic-'')
When a noun ends in <small>{{Tengwar|\j}}</small> -'''l''', the ending becomes <small>{{Tengwar|2$5}}</small> -'''den''': ::<small>{{Tengwar|t#aGj}}</small> '''macil''' "sword" → <small>{{Tengwar|t#aGm$5}}</small> '''macilden'''
Other nouns ending on a consonant have <small>{{Tengwar|`V5$5}}</small> -'''enen''' as ending: ::<small>{{Tengwar|`C6zGj%8}}</small> '''arquilis''' "desert" → <small>{{Tengwar|`C6zGj%iR5$5}}</small> '''arquilisenen'''
::<small>{{Tengwar|5~B8}}</small> '''nís''' "woman" → <small>{{Tengwar|5~B,R5$5}}</small> '''nissenen''' (stem-form <small>{{Tengwar|5%,\}}</small> ''niss-'')
===Plural=== In the plural we always add <small>{{Tengwar|\`V5}}</small> -'''en''' to the [[../Dative|dative]]:
::<small>{{Tengwar|t#aGj}}</small> '''macil''' "sword" → <small>{{Tengwar|t#aGj%5}}</small> macilin → <small>{{Tengwar|t#aGj%5$5}}</small> '''macilinen'''
::<small>{{Tengwar|}}</small> '''elda''' "elf" → <small>{{Tengwar|`VmlD5}}</small> eldain → <small>{{Tengwar|`VmlD5$5}}</small> '''eldainen''' (note: this ending forms a diphthong when the noun ends in <small>{{Tengwar|\`C}}</small> -'''a''', <small>{{Tengwar|\`N}}</small> -'''o''' or <small>{{Tengwar|\`M}}</small> -'''u''')
The exceptions are regular once you know the dative: ::<small>{{Tengwar|j#,R}}</small> '''lassë''' "leaf" → <small>{{Tengwar|j#,~B5}}</small> lassín → <small>{{Tengwar|j#,~B5$5}}</small> '''lassínen'''
::<small>{{Tengwar|t^65%`V}}</small> '''mornië''' "darkness" → <small>{{Tengwar|t^65~B5}}</small> mornín → <small>{{Tengwar|t^65~B5$5}}</small> '''mornínen'''
::<small>{{Tengwar|1~C7T}}</small> '''tári''' "queen" → <small>{{Tengwar|1~C7~B5}}</small> tárín → <small>{{Tengwar|1~C7~B5$5}}</small> '''tárínen'''
::<small>{{Tengwar|j~Nt$}}</small> '''lómë''' "night" → <small>{{Tengwar|j~Nt~B5}}</small> lómín → <small>{{Tengwar|j~Nt~B5$5}}</small> '''lómínen'''
===Dual=== In the dual we also add <small>{{Tengwar|\~V5}}</small> -'''en''' to the [[../Dative|dative]]: ::<small>{{Tengwar|`Cm&}}</small> '''aldu''' "a pair of trees" → <small>{{Tengwar|`Cm&5}}</small> aldun → <small>{{Tengwar|`Cm&5$5}}</small> '''aldunen''' (nom.sing.: <small>{{Tengwar|`Cm#}}</small> alda)
::<small>{{Tengwar|aG7ÎD1}}</small> '''ciryat''' "a pair of ships" → <small>{{Tengwar|aG7ÎD4}}</small> ciryant → <small>{{Tengwar|aG7ÎD4$5}}</small> '''ciryanten''' (nom.sing.: <small>{{Tengwar|aG7ÎD}}</small> cirya)
::<small>{{Tengwar|`C7E5$1}}</small> '''aranet''' "a pair of kings" → <small>{{Tengwar|`C7E5$4}}</small> aranent → <small>{{Tengwar|`C7E5$4$5}}</small> '''aranenten''' (nom.sing.: <small>{{Tengwar|`C7E5}}</small> aran)
===Partitive Plural=== When the nominative partitive plural ends in <small>{{Tengwar|\j°%}}</small> -'''lli''', the instrumental ends in <small>{{Tengwar|\j°%5$5}}</small> -'''llinen''': ::<small>{{Tengwar|1Y7Y5}}</small> '''toron''' "brother" → <small>{{Tengwar|1Y7Yj°%}}</small> '''torolli''' → <small>{{Tengwar|1Y7Yj°%5$5}}</small> '''torollinen'''
::<small>{{Tengwar|t#aGj}}</small> '''macil''' "sword" → <small>{{Tengwar|t#aGj°%}}</small> '''macilli''' → <small>{{Tengwar|t#aGj°%5$5}}</small> '''macillinen'''
When the nominative partitive plural only has a single <small>{{Tengwar|j}}</small> '''l''' before the final <small>{{Tengwar|`B}}</small> '''i''' then the instrumental ends in <small>{{Tengwar|j~B5$5}}</small> -'''línen''': ::<small>{{Tengwar|aG7ÎD}}</small> '''cirya''' "ship" → <small>{{Tengwar|aG7ÎDj%}}</small> '''ciryali''' → <small>{{Tengwar|aG7ÎDj~B5$5}}</small> '''ciryalínen'''
::<small>{{Tengwar|iD7E1}}</small> '''sarat''' "sign" → <small>{{Tengwar|iD7E1Rj%}}</small> '''sarateli''' → <small>{{Tengwar|iD7E1Rj~B5$5}}</small> '''saratelínen'''
----
>> [[Neo-Quenya]] >> [[../Nouns/]] >> [[../Instrumental/]]
{{BookCat}}

==Usage== This case is sometimes called the mystery-case because so little is known of it.
We only have a few examples by Tolkien himself, so different authors have used it in different ways. But as Helge Fauskanger notes: 'as these authors didn’t get nightly visits from Tolkien, we can regard these uses as acceptable'.
Most authors use it as a nephew of the [[../Locative|locative case]]: * to replace the proposition "by" when it used to describe a place: :<small>{{Tengwar|`B aY`C `B 1.D7R8}}</small> '''i coa i taures''' "the house by the forest" :This means "the house next to the forest", a locative has a slightly different meaning: :<small>{{Tengwar|`B aY`C `B 1.D7R,R}}</small> '''i coa i tauressë''' "the house in the forest"
* to replace the proposition "at" when it used to describe a place: :<small>{{Tengwar|`B aDj1E `B 7Ew#8}}</small> '''i calta i rambas''' "the picture at the wall" :This means "the picture hanging on the wall", a locative again has a slightly different meaning: :<small>{{Tengwar|`B aDj1E `B 7Ew#,R}}</small> '''i calta i rambassë''' "the picture on (top of) the wall"
==Formation== The formation is however well known, because Tolkien explained in a letter to Mr. Plotz: the respective can be formed by changing the final –'''n''' of the [[../Dative|dative]] into an –'''s''': ::<small>{{Tengwar|aG7ÎD8}}</small> '''ciryas''' "by a ship" (dative: <small>{{Tengwar|aG7ÎD5}}</small> ''ciryan'')
::<small>{{Tengwar|aG7ÎlD8}}</small> '''ciryais''' "by ships" (dative: <small>{{Tengwar|aG7ÎlD5}}</small> ''ciryain'')
::<small>{{Tengwar|aG7ÎDj%8}}</small> '''ciryalis''' "by some ships" (dative: <small>{{Tengwar|aG7ÎDj%5}}</small> ''ciryalin'')
The u-duals are formed in the same way: :<small>{{Tengwar|`Cm&8}}</small> '''aldus''' "by a pair of trees" (dative: <small>{{Tengwar|`Cm&5}}</small> ''aldun'')
The t-duals however have a special ending <small>{{Tengwar|\1R8}}</small> –'''tes''': :<small>{{Tengwar|aG7ÎD1R8}}</small> '''ciryates''' "by a pair of ships"
----
>> [[Neo-Quenya]] >> [[../Nouns/]] >> [[../Respective/]]
{{BookCat}}

== Licensing == {{PD-self}}
Jeez, I already have userpages on [[w:User:Betsythedevine|Wikipedia]] and [[m:User:Betsythedevine|meta]]...

My name is Dale Lyles. I am a media specialist at Newnan Crossing Elementary School in Newnan, Georgia. I think Wikijunior has a lot of potential to meet some of Georgia's curricular needs as we begin to implement our new curriculum, the [[http://www.georgiastandards.org Georgia Performance Standards]].

== [[People's Tactics/Units]] ==
Can you explain me why did you remove copyright warning from this page without giving any reason? --[[User:Derbeth|Derbeth]] [[User talk:Derbeth|<sup>talk</sup>]] 23:26, 27 November 2005 (UTC)
I'm not sure where to reply to your question so I'm doing it here. I've put a post in the discussion page of People's Tactics/Units giving a link to the permission I have been granted. Should I not remove copyright infringement notices myself? If not, then I'm sorry and won't do it again. I would point out that I have not seen anywhere in the wikibooks documentation anything telling me not to remove copyright infringement notices myself. And they're ugly.
: Ok, that's fine. But using "Summary" box often prevents from many cases of misunderstanding. If you wrote f.e. "removing copyvio - I have permission" there would be no problem. You should expand the scope and include things like: 1) typical sound spectra; 2) typical sound levels and loudness values; 3) influence of installation. The description of the sound generation mechanisms should be restricted to the ones that apply to electronic cooling fans. Use the material in the last presentations on influence of inflow. I would keep this as a seperate entry, referenced in the "how to build a quiet PC" entry, for those who want to know a little more about the theory. Quiet PC builders will probably be largely content with practical guidance. Also, as the title suggests...merging in this information may obscure it from those interested in cooling things other than PCs

==Ruby== The wikipedia entry is [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ruby_programming_language here]. ===Type=== Ruby is a full objected-oriented language.
===Execution Entry Point=== <Describe how/where the program is started i.e. C++ main()> ===General Syntax=== <Try to give a high level description of the contents of a typical line of code. An assignment example may be appropriate such as a = b; > ===Comments=== Pound signs (#) designate comments in Ruby # this is an inline comment. Everything after the # is a comment.
===Variable Declarations=== Ruby does not require explicit variable declarations. The following is perfectly valid Ruby code x = 5 (x:5) z = x+3 (z:8) string = 'a string' (string:'a string') longstring = string+string (longstring:'a stringa string')
Yet there are times when a declaration of type is necessary. In the following operation the array named 'objects' must be defined as an array so it can use the << method of adding elements to the array objects = [] objects << "my 1st array elements" objects << "my 2nd array element" objects << 52=+3 (objects: ["my 1st array element", "my 2nd array element", 55])
===Method Declaration/Implementation=== <Describe how methods/functions/procedures are declared and implemented.> ===Scope=== <Describe how scope is defined.> ===Conditional Statements=== <Describe the conditional statements in text and present code examples. (put a space in the front of the line to format as code)> ===Looping Statements=== <Describe looping statements in English and present code examples.> ===Output Statements=== <Describe how to output ''Hello world!'' including the new-line with or without a carriage return.>
===Error Handling/Recovery=== <Describe error handling and recovery. Give examples as appropriate.>
===Containers=== <List containers or references to lists of containers available natively for this language. List ways to incorporate containers if they are not native to the language.> ===Algorithms=== <List algorithms or references to lists of algorithms available natively for this language. List ways to incorporate algorithms if they are not native to the language. Or, if not available, describe that.> ===Garbage collection=== <Describe whether the garbage collection is automatic or manual.> ===Physical Structure=== <Describe how the files, libararies, and parts are typically divided and arranged.> ===Tips=== <Please include tips that make it easier to switch to this language from another language.> ===Web References=== <List additional references on the web. Please include for what level reader the references are appropriate. (beginner/intermediate/advanced)> ===Books and Articles=== <List additional books and articles that may be helpful. Please include for what level reader the references are appropriate. (beginner/intermediate/advanced)>

Hello, The developer team at Wikimedia is making some changes to how accounts work, as part of our on-going efforts to provide new and better tools for our users like cross-wiki notifications. These changes will mean you have the same account name everywhere. This will let us give you new features that will help you edit and discuss better, and allow more flexible user permissions for tools. One of the side-effects of this is that user accounts will now have to be unique across all 900 Wikimedia wikis. See [[m:Special:MyLanguage/Single User Login finalisation announcement|the announcement]] for more information. Unfortunately, your account clashes with another account also called Chrishu. To make sure that both of you can use all Wikimedia projects in future, we have reserved the name Chrishu~enwikibooks that only you will have. If you like it, you don't have to do anything. If you do not like it, you can [[Special:GlobalRenameRequest|pick out a different name]]. Your account will still work as before, and you will be credited for all your edits made so far, but you will have to use the new account name when you log in. Sorry for the inconvenience. Yours,
[[m:User:Keegan (WMF)|Keegan Peterzell]]
Community Liaison, Wikimedia Foundation

For this reason I have included some historical context. If it is reasonably comprehensible, then why worry? IMHO English grammar is merely DESCRIPTIVE never PRESCRIPTIVE. Anyway minor errors of interpretation lead us to new understandings (which is why I reject the 'final absolute truth' of scriptural authority). For spelling I use Firefox, because I am a bit dyslexic, and it includes a multi-lingual spell checker as well as editor support. [[User:Timpo|Timpo]] ([[User talk:Timpo|talk]]) 09:48, 28 September 2009 (UTC) == Copyright Questions == I am taking a look at this Wikibook, and it seems a little bit too extensive so far. Let me just say that the tone of the book and the kind of material that has been presented here reminds me of copyright violations I have seen in the past. '''Please''', when you add material to Wikibooks, make sure you read the disclaimer at the bottom of the edit window that clearly requests that you make sure all contributions are compatable with the GNU Free Document License, including copyright permission to republish under the GFDL if you are doing more than a fair-use quotation of copyrighted material. If you need help to determine exactly what is Fair-use, please make a request on [[Wikibooks:Staff Lounge]]. I'm not making a specific acusation, but just a friendly reminder. If you make original contribution, those are especially welcome here. Also try to keep a '''Neutral Point of View''' (NPOV) as well, which I know with philosophy books is especially difficult to maintain. {{Wikibooks help}} {{shortcut|WB:EDIT}} {{TOC left|limit=3}} Wikibooks is a [[w:Wiki|wiki]], which means that anyone can easily edit any unprotected page and save those changes immediately to that page. After your first edit you are a Wikibooks editor! To request a change to a protected page, you may add your suggestion to the talk page. Editing a Wikibooks page is not very hard. Simply click on the ''Edit'' tab at the top of a Wikibooks page (or on an [edit] link). This will bring you to a new page with a text box containing the editable text of the original page. If you just want to experiment, please do so in the [[Wikibooks:sandbox|sandbox]]. You should write a short edit summary in the small field below the edit box. You may use shorthand to describe your changes, and when you have finished, press the ''Show preview'' button to see how your changes will look. You can also see the difference between the page with your edits and the previous version of the page by pressing the ''Show changes'' button. If you're satisfied with what you see, be bold and press the ''Save page'' button. Your changes will immediately be visible to other Wikibooks users. [[File:English Wikibooks editing.png|475px|thumb|center|What you'll see when you go to edit a page.]]
== Composition of an edit page == The editing page consists of these sections: * [[#Edit toolbar|Edit toolbar]] * Editing text box * [[#Edit summary|Edit summary]] box * [[#Minor edit checkbox|Minor edit]], [[Help:Tracking changes#Watching pages|Watch this page]] checkboxes * Save page, [[#Show preview button|Show preview]], [[Help:Tracking changes#Viewing diffs|Show changes]] buttons * Cancel, Editing help links * A list of [[Help:Template|template]]s used on the page * A preview, if you have requested one. Your preferences may place the preview at the top of the page instead. ===Edit toolbar=== The '''edit toolbar''' above the editing text box helps you produce '''wiki markup''', instructions used to stylize text on a wiki page. In the edit toolbar above the editing text box seen when editing a page, if you click ''Help'' you can see what effects are possible with wiki markup. Another way you can learn how to produce specific effects is to click ''Edit'' on a page that contains the effect you wish to copy and see what markup is used. {| class="wikitable" style="width:100%;" ! width="26%" | Name ! width="36%" | Markup ! width="37%" | Displays |- ! colspan="3" style="text-align:left; background-color:#cccccc;" | Basic |- | [[File:Toolbaricon_bold_B.png|link=]] Bold | Make text '''bold''' | Make text '''bold''' |- | [[File:Toolbaricon_italic_I.png|link=]] Italic | Make text ''italic'' | Make text ''italic'' |- | [[File:Button_underline_he.png|link=]] Underline | Make textunderlined | Make text underlined |- | [[File:Vector_strikeout.png|link=]] Strikeout | Strike out text | Strike out text |- | [[File:Vector_toolbar_insert_link_button.png|link=]] [[#Links|Link]] | Link to [[Help:Contents|a page]], [[#Sections|a section of a page]] or an [http://www.wikimedia.org external page]. | Link to [[Help:Contents|a page]], [[#Sections|a section of a page]] or an [http://www.wikimedia.org external page]. |- | [[File:Vector toolbar insert image button.png|link=]] Embed [[Help:Files|file]] | [[File:Vector toolbar insert image button.png]] | [[File:Vector toolbar insert image button.png]] |- | [[File:Vector toolbar insert reference button.png|link=]] Insert [[#References|references]] | Example textIt is a note! | Example text[1] |- | [[File:Vector toolbar signature button.png|link=]] Signature | Thanks guys --~~~~ | Thanks guys --[[User:Example|Example]] 07:46, 27 November 2005 (UTC) |- ! colspan="3" style="text-align:left; background-color:#cccccc;" | Advanced |- | Heading [[File:MediaWiki_Vector_skin_action_arrow.png|link=]] Dropdown list for headings of different levels | == Level 2 (Section heading) == === Level 3 === ==== Level 4 ==== ===== Level 5 ===== | {{hiddenh2|Level 2 (Section heading)}}{{hiddenh3|Level 3}}{{hiddenh4|Level 4}}{{hiddenh5|Level 5}} |- | Text Type [[File:MediaWiki_Vector_skin_action_arrow.png|link=]] Dropdown list for text or programming code of different types | Teletype text, inline code, generic source code | Teletype text, inline code, generic source code |- | [[File:Vector toolbar bulleted list button.png|link=]] Insert a bulleted [[#Lists|list]] item | * Bulleted list item | * Bulleted list item |- | [[File:Vector toolbar numbered list button.png|link=]] Insert a numbered [[#Lists|list]] item | # Numbered list item | # Numbered list item |- | [[File:Vector toolbar indentation button.png|link=]] Text indentation | :Indented line | :Indented line |- | [[File:Vector toolbar no wiki formatting button.png|link=]] Ignore wiki markup | 2^3 | 2^3 |- | [[File:Vector toolbar insert new line button.png|link=]] Insert new line | example
